About the job
            
 
The Remote Sensing unit of VITO processes petabytes of earth observation data. We primarily specialise in Big Data analysis with the use of machine learning and deep learning techniques in the application workflows. That is our passion: the extraction of information from the vast amounts of incoming images. Information required by our clients. Our extensive group of clients can be found within the domains of land use, civil infrastructure, agriculture, forestry, water management, heritage and ecological development.To enforce VITO’s remote sensing unit, we’re looking for a Data Engineer to build services and applications. Together with the team you will support remote sensing projects that are executed on openEO, which is an open-source cloud-based service for the processing of huge satellite imagery datasets. You will collaborate with data scientists that are global experts in their fields. This position gives you the opportunity to work on projects with global visibility, focused on supporting the green transition towards a sustainable planet. Your work is used by the European Commission and the European Space Agency, who rely on it to provide timely and accurate information to experts working in the field, trying to have local impact while ensuring food security or fighting climate change.You'll become part of a talented, dedicated team working in a fast-paced, challenging international environment. A strong technical background in Python programming and data engineering in general is required to support these projects. Knowledge of earth observation applications is a plus, but fast learners that are interested in exploring this domain are more than welcome to apply.Most user projects use a form of machine learning or artificial intelligence to extract information from satellite imagery. In this role, you continuously interact with internal and external teams that look for efficient ways to train their models and want to run them in production.You implement techniques such as ML Ops to make these projects run smoothly and efficiently. A keen eye for constant improvement is a must to be successful in your role.Your responsibilities: You are part of a team of software engineers to develop efficient algorithms, models, back-end extensions, and proof of concepts, with a hands-on mentality.Engage with architects, subject matter experts and project owners to translate their project requirements into data pipelines/workflows and make these run efficiently.Use the openEO ecosystem to create production workflows, analytics applications and data visualization.Implementation of continuous improvements and maintenance activities in workflows and processes.Keep track of the latest developments and technologies in the software, AI and remote sensing world to be able to remain state-of-the-art in our domain.
Job requirements: Master’s degree applied sciences, specialized in computer science or equivalentProfound knowledge in Python programmingProven experience with data engineering is a large assetUnderstanding of different remote sensing data sets such as the Copernicus Sentinel satellites can be an assetExperience in Continuous Integration, Testing & Automation frameworksExperience in cloud native deployments is a plusExperience in large scale data processing (e.g. Spark) is a plusExcellent command of English, Dutch is a plus
You are a real team player and blend easily in a group. You’ve got an engaging personality, good communication skills and you are self-organized. Strong analytical skills are crucial given that you will participate in an ambitious team where constantly evolving IT and Earth Observation business needs.Do you want to join us? Please apply, we look forward to your application.Offer We work 'activity-based', our activities bring us to our location. Our headquarter is in Mol. Part-time working from home or a satellite office in Antwerp-Berchem, Ghent or Ostend is possible.A competitive salary with a range of benefits, including allowances, insurance and a modular package of holidays.Innovation is our asset, so it goes without saying that we give our employees the opportunity to take additional training courses and stay up-to-date in their field. You will always have the opportunity to broaden your knowledge and discover new technologies.You will have the opportunity to be part of an organization with an international reputation, known for its cutting-edge technological research and scientific consultancy.With us, you will contribute directly to sustainable developments at local, national and global level through your innovative applications. You provide answers to contemporary societal challenges.Moreover, we highly value a good work-life balance at VITO! This is achieved by adopting a flexible attitude depending on your specific needs.

job_title: Big Data Engineer (Business Intelligence, Data Platform Team)
job_description:
About the job
            
 
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!What you’ll have to do:  Define and maintain the overall Data Platform ecosystem based on Big Data Technology stack.Implement the data strategy, with a focus on performance and optimizations.You will collaborate with Customer (Internal), Business Analysts and Data Analysts to find solutions for business problems.Learn and understand organization's business processes and requirements.Design, build and maintain scalable/reliable data pipelines.Ensure good performance and quality of existing Data Pipelines.Create documentation and present it among the colleagues.Research, apply and keep in contact with the latest technologies.Share knowledge, help, and guide team members.Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all business intelligence systems, with a specific focus on product data.
 How we’d like you to be:    University degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering;Have 5+ years of experience in working with Big Data technologies;Have experience with some of Hadoop ecosystem components: Spark, Hive, Impala, Cloudera, HDFS, Livy, YARN, Kafka;Good knowledge of programming languages like Scala or Python;Familiar with column-oriented data files like Parquet or high-performance formats like Iceberg;Have experience with orchestration tools like: Apache Airflow;Have experience with CI/CD tools like Gitlab;Have experience with Data Warehouse/ Data Lake;Have experience with Linux systems;
Will be a plus: Experience with relational databases, such as SQL Server, Oracle or MySQLDevOps skills: KubernetesCloud experienceMonitoring/Logging/Operations: Prometheus, Grafana.
 What we’ve prepared for you: Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife, or Regina Maria;A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms, or even professional development classes;Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine, or wellness;Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform;An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies, and development programs;A friendly office. We redesigned our headquarters office to suit our hybrid work model: we doubled the number of meeting rooms and equipped them with state-of-the-art technology.
Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will call you for more details!

About the job
            
 
Senior Data Engineer | European leader in technology | Stockholm, SwedenI am delighted to present a fantastic new opportunity within one of Europe's leading technology companies, who provide the best solutions for digital transformations in enterprise businesses, helping them become bigger competitors to the rest of the market.As a Senior Data Engineer you will be joining the data and analytics team who specialise in the delivery of expert data reporting solutions for finance, sales, projects and more. As a leading Microsoft partner you will be working with the most up to date and modern technology such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, and Power BI.Responsibilities  Develop robust data warehouses with an end-user focus for a range of processes.Build the infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation and loading from a variety of sources.Write efficient codes.Use new technology such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services, Power BI Premium and more.Create fast and precise data models.
Requirements Experience within Microsoft's Data Platform, on-premises or cloud.Experience with ETL processes, data warehouses and data modelling.Very good skills and experience with SQL.Fluent Swedish and English language.Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or other relevant areas.
What can they offer you? Competitive salary plus additional bonus based on company and personal performance.Excellent pension and healthcare packages.5 weeks vacation time.Fantastic work life balance and flexible hybrid working model.Support for extra training opportunities including new certifications.
Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.

About the job
            
 
Beyond:Putting Data to Work delivers data-led strategic consulting services globally, bringing cutting-edge data science, engineering, analytics and visualisation expertise by having the highest quality talent, borderless data services and best-in-class creative thinking.​We pride ourselves on our ability to swiftly get under the skin of our clients’ challenges and bring fresh perspectives and solutions to allow them to succeed, whatever their market, wherever their location.We deliberately recruit professionals with diverse experience which makes for a culture of healthy challenge, respect and collaboration.We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Vilnius based team and while this is a hybrid role (NOT REMOTE) where you may combine working from home with time in the office, you must be prepared to travel to the office on a weekly basis. As part of the Data Engineering team, you will be working alongside the Technology, Analytics and Commercial Teams. You will design and create cutting edge data solutions to our clients across various domains.Main responsibilities Building new automated, re-usable, scalable and secure data processes.Maintaining existing data processing pipelines, troubleshooting issues and implementing fixes.Monitoring data processing efficiency and proposing solutions for improvements
Required Skills and Experience Excellent knowledge of SQLKnowledge of Python (other languages might be equivalent)Experience in creating and maintaining ETL pipelinesKnow your way around Unix based operating systemExperience working with any major cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure)Fluency in English
Preferred skills and Experience: Experience using Apache AirflowExperience using DockerExperience using Apache Spark
The right candidate can expect to receive the following:Competitive Salary From €2750 to €5000 gross per month (dependent on experience) plus benefits Performance Based BonusFlexible WorkingPrivate Medical InsuranceWellbeing ProgrammeEmployee Assistance Program20 Days annual leave + Public HolidaysVolunteering LeaveUdemy SubscriptionsCompany events

About the job
            
 
Founded in 2019, Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) plays a major role in the Volkswagen Group strategy of going digital, by developing software mainly for the digital ecosystems and internal corporate processes.Split across 3 tech units: CODE (Core Operations + Development), MAN Digital Hub and SDC (Software Development Center), VWDS plays a key part of the digitalization strategy that is happening in the Group.Our Mindset | Open for new ways, transparent in what we do and responsive to requests!Our Target | Creating value, being customer focused and delivering continuously!The ProjectVolkswagen Group, with headquarters in Germany and operations around the world, is implementing the Global Purchasing Suite (GPS), a tool to improve the existing purchasing systems for all brands, regions, and suppliers. One of the suite's module is GPS Analytics, which aims to collect and analyze purchasing data and make it available to procurement buyers and analytics teams.The GPS Analytics Suite brings together cross-brand and cross-regional data from the operative procurement systems in a central data storage system and provides interfaces for transactional data consumed productively by GPS product streams, making it available for reports and analyzes across the group.What you'll be doingThe day-to-day activities of a Data Engineer are the following (but not limited to):  Analyze a source of data; Build the data model; Build/Develop its transformation; Deployment in AWS.
What we expect from you  Degree in related knowledge area or comparable job expertise; Very good English skills, both written and spoken; At least 6 Years of Experience in Data Warehouse / Data Modelling; Good knowledge of SQL; Experience in Cloud Environments; Have initiative to solve problems and overcome roadblocks; Be a result-oriented and communicative team player.
Nice to have:  AWS S3 AWS Redshift AWS Glue AWS Lambda AWS CDK Spark
Benefits & PerksThis is a true opportunity to join an amazing atmosphere on our local company culture build up, with the support of a solid international group, and to be part of an Agile environment where you can learn, share, and interact in a place where your ideas are valued and you have a voice.  Flexible working hours Remote friendly model adapted to each team’s needs and preferences Continuous learning with access to Udemy Wellbeing program extendable to your household Health insurance extendable to your household Life insurance Opportunity to join the company’s pension fund Home Office Setup to build your dream home office Home allowance, to receive in your payslip or use in our flexible benefits platform (e.g. internet/data expenses, public transports card) Smartphone + Telecom with voice & data plan Discounts on VW Group cars and special conditions on financing Relocation package (if applicable) & Visa process sponsorship
Unsure if you meet all these requirements? Please apply anyway! We would love to hear from you!

About the job
            
 
📣 Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?Founded in 2006 under the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specialising in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.By developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.We are now looking for a Data Engineer willing to accept new challenges in the Transport sector in our Closer team.Are you the one? +5 years of experience in data management and Big Data;Experience with Python programming, SQL, and ETL processing;Strong knowledge of Apache Kafka, Airflow, Data Lake, Data Warehouse concepts, and data pipeline design;Knowledge of Scala, NoSQL databases and microservices architecture (is a plus);Good communication, proactivity, and teamwork;Fluent in Portuguese (C1);Availability to work hybrid from Lisbon.

About the job
            
 
At Infobip, we dream big. We value creativity, persistence, and innovation, passionately believing that it is through teamwork that we can all reach greater heights.Since 2006, we have been innovating at the edge of technological possibilities and are now shaping global communications of the future. Through 70+ offices on six continents, Infobip’s platform is used by almost 70% of the population, making it the largest network of its kind and the only full-stack cloud communication platform globally.Join us on our mission to create life-changing interactions between humans and online services with new and unseen solutions.Purpose of the roleData Engineers are focused on improving the process of identifying valuable critical data, collecting, structuring, and utilizing data to create comprehensive analytics to support different aspects of our business streams.Our team is developing insights used in various scenarios with a curious and business-driven mindset. We work on understanding customer satisfaction, defining and tracking key business metrics, and informing the future roadmap for data-driven decision-making that will push our company to the edge of innovation.As a technology-agnostic company, we seek optimal technical solutions so that you will work on various tools and DWH/BI/ML platforms using different programming languages. In this role, you will partner with solution/information architects, managers, analysts, and engineers across the globe to enable timely and actionable insights aligned with the business’s key strategies. You will perform deep analyses to understand customer usage patterns and behaviors in conjunction with our broader analytics stakeholders.Responsibilities  In cooperation with architects, analyze stakeholder requirements for information and analytics needs, and identify pain points and areas of improvement in the current setup. Process evaluation, mapping, and design improvements by evaluating methodologies and assuring implementation of best practices. Cooperate with Engineers, Product Managers, Product Analysts, Revenue organization, and decision-makers to understand data needs and manage cloud-based DWH and functional DataMart development plans for different subject areas (i.e., Customer 360, Products, Profitability, Sales process improvements…). Design, build, test, launch, and monitor efficient cloud-based data mapping, assuring seamless process integration within the data analytics tools stack to improve data-driven decision-making for internal and external stakeholders. ETL development, debugging, optimizing performance, and deploying to production. Optimize data retrieval from internal data sources, and understand how to develop dashboards, reports, and other visualizations for stakeholders. Prepare and document the end-to-end technical process, data flow specifications, and code, ensuring optimal integration with current systems and applications. Assure seamless process integration within the data analytics tools stack to improve data-driven decision-making. Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality. Participate in Data Governance and Quality assurance processes.
Qualifications  At least 3+ years in DWH/BI space, ETL design and development, and usage of SQL/PLSQL/TSQL and some other data integration tool (i.e., SSIS, Informatica, OWB, ODI, SAS DI Studio, IBM Data Stage…) Strong aptitude for learning new technologies related to Data Management (cloud computing services preferred) and Data Science Experience designing data models and data warehouses and using SQL or NoSQL database management systems (i.e., MS SQL Server, Oracle RDBMS, IBM DB2, Hadoop stack, NoSQL engine…) Experience in the design and implementation of cloud-based data platform architecture is an advantage Data architecture experience across data platforms, APIs, and Azure cloud architectures Good knowledge of Microsoft cloud computing services (i.e., Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse, Azure ML…) Excellent debugging, critical thinking, analytical, and communication skills Familiarity with data governance and agile methodology is an advantage Proven track record of working with noisy, dirty, and unstructured data. Data cleansing, scraping unstructured data, and converting it into structured data are preferred Knowledge of and experience with Python, REST APIs, JSON as a data source is plus
When you become a part of Infobip you can expect: Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve. Learn as you grow – Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Connect globally – Work with people from all over the world. We put the “global” in globalization. Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team building and other organized activities ... Talk about a balanced lifestyle!Infobip employees are people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, and experiences that share the same passion and talent that helps us achieve our mission. That's why Infobip is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status, or any other part of one's identity.

About the job
            
 
Werk jij als IT-er liever bij een grote onderneming of een juist klein bedrijf? a.s.r. biedt het beste van twee werelden: een internationale werkomgeving, uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden, volop ontwikkelkansen, een klein informeel team én gave teamuitjes. Solliciteer daarom snel op de vacature van ETL Developer bij a.s.r.!Als ETL Developer vind je binnen het agile DWH Klantcontactteam van verzekeraar a.s.r. een mooie uitdaging binnen het ICT vakgebied: het verwerken van Microsoft Dynamics data én data uit externe bronnen, zoals Google Analytics en Tealium, in het datawarehouse. De veranderende klantcontact omgeving, die van oudsher bestond uit klantcontactdata als telefonie, vullen we aan met klantcontact data van bijvoorbeeld websites. Zo helpen we a.s.r. met behulp van data nog beter de klant op alle kanalen te helpen. Voor ons is dit een nieuwe manier van werken. Maar we maken hierbij graag gebruik van jouw ervaring met SQL, PL/SQL, Datastage én je kennis van Oracle Databases. Zo krijg jij helder waar de problemen én de oplossingen liggen. Weet je ook voldoende van Azure, Microsoft Dynamics, Google Analytics en/of Tealium en heb je kennis van klantcontact data? Dan ben je de ideale kandidaat voor de functie van ETL Developer op de IT afdeling van a.s.r. en kun je zo snel mogelijk beginnen!Dit ga je doen als ETL Developer je ontwerpt en bouwt ETL-processenje lost integratievraagstukken en productiestoringen opje voert preventief en correctief onderhoud uit, zowel functioneel als technischje draagt zorg voor verbeteringen in kwaliteit en performanceje ondersteunt bij het maken en afstemmen van Oracle-query's
Deze vacature is echt iets voor jou, want jij hebt hbo werk- en denkniveau, bijvoorbeeld door een studie Bedrijfskundige Informatica, en minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring als ETL Developer, -Engineer of -Specialisthebt aantoonbare ervaring met DataWareHouses en ETL-processen in een Oracle omgeving én kennis van datawarehouse concepten, zoals relationeel en dimensioneel modeleren, DataVault en Datamarthebt ervaring met performance/tuning van laadprocessen, laadcontroles en incidentmanagementhebt ervaring met en/of kennis van Microsoft Dynamics, Google Analytics en/of Tealiumbent resultaatgerichte en analytische teamplayer. Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden, ook in het Engels (spreken en schrijven)
Dit bieden we je een bruto salaris van € 3.500,- tot € 5.200,- op basis van 38 uur per week plus een 13e maand en 8% vakantievergoedingeen heel goede pensioenregeling: a.s.r. betaalt minimaal 19,8% premie en dat kan oplopen tot 35,3%, jouw eigen bijdrage is maar 4,5%bij a.s.r. zijn we flexibel in thuiswerken: we werken gemiddeld 60% thuis en 40% op kantoor en je hebt veel ruimte om je eigen werktijden te bepaleneen flexibele werkplek op ons prachtige hoofdkantoor in Utrecht met veel faciliteiten én een NS-Business Card met vrij reizen.veel aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vitaliteitwerk waarmee je een positieve invloed hebt op de samenleving van morgen; samen stropen we onze mouwen op voor een eerlijkere en duurzamere toekomst
Hier ga je werken als ETL Developer in UtrechtJe gaat aan de slag op onze centrale IT afdeling, in het DWH Klantcontact team, een informeel, enthousiast team dat graag samenwerkt. Alle teamleden staan open voor verandering, zelfs voor een andere taal. Waar de voertaal eerst Nederlands was, stappen we nu over op het Engels. Je krijgt alle ruimte om zelf te bepalen waar je werkt, thuis of op het mooie, duurzame a.s.r. kantoor, en hoe je je tijd indeelt. Ook heb je veel vrijheid om je rol vorm te geven en je, zowel persoonlijk als vakinhoudelijk, te blijven ontwikkelen. Omdat goed én leuk is om samen live en buiten het werk om dingen te doen, organiseren we regelmatig sociale activiteiten.Solliciteer op deze IT vacatureEnthousiast geworden? Reageer via de button ‘solliciteer’. Bij a.s.r. geloven we dat verschillen ons samen sterker en beter maken en voor ons tellen alleen je kwaliteiten. Daarom vinden we het prima als jij in jouw cv geen geboortedatum, geslacht en geboorteplaats opneemt.Hier vind je meer informatie over het sollicitatieproces.Wij werken op een prettige manier samen met een aantal preferred suppliers. Acquisitie door werving- en selectie-, detachering- of uitzendbureaus wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

About the job
            
 
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 500 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide. We are a differentiator in the market who provides the stability of a Bank and the flexibility of a Fintech, in order to deliver a payments solution to our clients as we continue transforming the Banking and Payments industry for the new economy.About the roleWe are looking to hire a skilled Senior Data Engineer, to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Engineering Team Lead.In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle’s Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines. What you will be doing Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peersDesign and optimize the use of Data Platform based on business needsRecommend approaches in which stakeholders could apply data to business problemsAdvocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modellingEnhance our data infrastructure to improve the reliability and computational efficiency of our Data PlatformCollaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organizationParticipate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
What we are looking forTo be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. It is a big advantage if you have five years of relevant work experience with the tech stack used by our Data Engineering team. Furthermore, we expect that you have a solid understanding of Python, Terraform, and Azure Pipelines, including code organization and testing. It is ideal if you have proficiency in software development in a Linux environment and experience with relational database systems and data warehouses. You should also be well-versed with Agile development principles and have experience with applying them in the daily work.As a person you are proactive with a quality oriented and structured approach to problem solving. You are not afraid to contribute to continuous improvements of the team’s way of working. You have an open and curious mindset, and you should also be comfortable with working in a fast-paced environment where you can juggle several tasks simultaneously. You possess excellent communication skills and are a dependable and knowledge-sharing-team-player. You should enjoy both working in teams but also be good at working on individual tasks.As Banking Circle is an international company it´s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.What we offer youWe offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity. However, we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.Would you like to join us?We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email.If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.Who we areBanking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world’s clearing systems – enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.comWe are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

About the job
            
 
ABOUT THE ROLEAs a Data Engineer you’ll be working with designers, developers and other data experts to make the most of our projects using data as building blocks. At CLEVER°FRANKE we’re experts at creating data driven solutions, such as dashboards, microsites and physical installations; and data is at the core of all of them.In a project like “Voices from the Frontlines” your work entails building pipelines that transform data from tabular and geospatial datasets, in order to generate visualizations and maps using Python and QGIS. Additionally, you’ll be in charge of producing the vector tilesets to import in Mapbox, which builds a spatial data portal. In other projects, you may need to retrieve data from a client database, or connect to an existing API. Sometimes you will build a tailored database for data processing and transformation, and provide connections for our development team to generate data-driven animations. We encourage you to suggest solutions that will help our team and partners in building robust and efficient experiences.Being able to collaborate well with others is important to us, with the project team as well as with the clients and their teams. In addition, you will focus on understanding the data needs of a project, both from a visual and implementation perspective. You make sure that the data arrives in the right format to safeguard qualitative and truthful implementation. At times, this includes building data extractions, transformations, and loading pipelines.Our approach to data is flexible and adapted to the project’s characteristics. This means that data can be delivered to us as files, available on cloud storage systems, in private or public databases, or accessible through APIs. You will be building and maintaining simple databases or interacting with existing ones. Finding (and working with) external, publicly available open source data is often part of our work.Quality, reproducibility, accuracy, and security are core values of our data work. Your contributions on ensuring and improving our methods regarding these will always be appreciated.JOIN THE TEAMCLEVER°FRANKE is an enthusiastic, multi-disciplinary team of 40+ people with 12+ nationalities from across the world. We are interaction designers, visual designers, developers, project managers, data analysts, and others. All with a passion for what we do. We are curious about the world around us and apply the same curiosity to our work and projects.WE'LL WELCOME YOUYou’re welcome at CLEVER°FRANKE regardless of your appearance, identity, or background. It’s not a place you have to 'fit in' but somewhere everyone can feel themselves and be their best to do their best.Studies suggest that women, and others, tend to hesitate to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, we look for talent and potential — not just formal experience and expertise. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it, go ahead and apply.WE’LL GIVE YOU Full-time/part-time role (32-40 hours per week);A competitive salary, based on your background and experience;Guidance from a friendly, passionate, down-to-earth team;Trainings tailored to your personal and professional growth;A personal development coach and time to explore your interests;Hybrid working from our studio or home – (at least 2 days per week in the studio);A healthy, abundant lunch every day in the studio;Paid train expenses from your home to the studio;A MacBook and all the peripherals you need;A collective pension plan;Inspiring team events; such as our annual team prototyping day, team trainings, sport events and conference visits.
WE'LL SUPPORT YOUWe find it important that you grow and challenge yourself and want to ensure that you are supported in this. We offer training courses tailored to your experience level and needs, personal development planning and feedback, and an HR coach. About 3 times a year, we organize a CLEVER°FRANKE Development week where the entire studio fully focuses on personal and professional growth, outside of client projects.WHAT YOU BRINGYou have at least 2 years of experience with data engineering. You’re able to build and maintain data infrastructure and data pipelines. You’re comfortable working with Python and maintaining databases. You have SQL & data profiling skills and use these to conduct insightful data analyses. You have experience with API design and/or data mocking and are familiar with cloud services and GIT Version control.You have a keen interest in data visualization, data-driven working and product development. You have a methodical approach to your work and attention to detail, and you take initiative and ownership of your domain. You actively suggest and implement project-specific solutions for data management, workflow and processes.BONUS POINTS: Data science skills and/or geospatial data knowledgeExperience with data visualization and prototyping
WOULD YOU LIKE TO JOIN US?Send us your CV via our vacancy on our career page and we'll ask you some questions to get to know you a little better.QUESTIONS?Please contact Charlene Benjamins for questions about this job opening at charlene@cleverfranke.com.Acquisition based on this job opening is not appreciated

Maintenir une veille technologique constante. Les compétences techniques requises comprennent : Analyser et développer des \"produits transversaux prêts à l'emploi pour nos activités\". Principalement développer en Java jusqu'à l'intégration avec les chaînes CI/CD. Avoir une maîtrise des langages de programmation suivants : Java, Scala, Python (dans le contexte du Big Data). Être compétent dans les plateformes de configuration et de gestion des déploiements : Ansible, Terraform, etc. Avoir une bonne connaissance de l'écosystème de stockage d'objets et de Kubernetes : API S3, Helm, etc. Maîtriser l'écosystème Hadoop (HDFS, Hive, etc.), Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch/SolR. Avoir une solide compréhension de l'écosystème de transport de données : kafka connect, etc. Maîtriser le framework Spring : Spring-Boot, Spring-Security, etc. Avoir une maîtrise du framework React pour le développement des interfaces utilisateur. Posséder des connaissances des concepts NoSQL et être compétent dans au moins une solution parmi celles-ci : Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis, PostGres. Avoir une compréhension des concepts de streaming, notamment Flink. Si vous êtes intéressé(e) par cette opportunité et que vous pensez répondre aux critères mentionnés ci-dessus veuillez envoyer votre CV a -email masqué-XX Nous restons à votre disposition pour répondre à toutes vos questions supplémentaires. Cordialement, Gael Kisombe Lawrence Harvey is acting as an Employment Business in regards to this position. Visit our website and follow us on Twitter for all live vacancies (lawharveyjobs)

About the job
            
 
Pour soutenir la croissance de notre équipe spécialisée sur le développement logiciel et l'intégration de solutions digitales pour les entreprises, nous sommes à la recherche d'un ingénieur qualification et tests automatiques.Intégré à l'équipe projet, vous interviendrez en tant que consultant sur l’intégration des composants logiciels d’une solution de transfert d’argent et de paiement sécurisé d’Orange déployée dans plusieurs pays dans le monde.Vos activités principales : Préparation des environnements d’intégration et de qualification, en partie avec de l’automatisationMaintien et évolution de l’outillage, des jeux de données et des configurationsPréparation des mises en production et soutien à l’équipe d’exploitation si nécessaireAppropriation des nouvelles fonctionnalités à déployerInteractions avec le Product Owner, le Scrum Master, les architectes, les équipes de développements et de qualificationParticipation aux cérémonies Agile et au reporting hebdomadaire avec le responsable intégration-validationSupport à l’équipe de qualificationSupport occasionnel en production et préanalyse des problèmes constatés
Profil De formation Bac+4 ou BAC+5, vous justifiez d'une première expérience de 2 ans minimum en tant qu’intégrateur ou développeur.Compétences : Doté d'un excellent relationnel (oral et écrit),Vous savez travailler de manière autonome sur les projets qui vous sont confiésVotre flexibilité et votre esprit d'équipe vous permettront une bonne intégration au sein du projetVous êtes force de proposition dans la réalisation de vos tâches, et aimez les défisOrganisé et rigoureux, vous appliquez les bonnes pratiques du test
Compétences techniques nécessaires : Maîtrise du système Linux et du scripting BashMaîtrise de l’outil de versioning de code source GitMaîtrise d’un outil d’intégration et déploiement continu tel que Gitlab-CI, Jenkins ou TFSCompétences sur les API REST et la mise en œuvre d’outil de tests tels que SoapUI, JMeter ou PostmanCompétences sur le déploiement de composants logiciels en conteneurs avec Docker, Kubernetes ou OpenShiftExpérience significative avec ELK et en particulier LogstashExpérience sur base de données NoSQL et si possible sur MongoDB
Compétences qui seraient un plus : Compétences en développement Javascript sous NodeJSConnaissances d’un outil d’automatisation tel que Ansible ou TerraformConnaissances des outils de supervision : Kibana, Prometheus, Grafana
Chez Orange, seules vos compétences comptent :Quel que soit votre âge, genre, origine, religion, orientation sexuelle, neuroatypie, handicap ou apparence, nous encourageons la diversité au sein de nos équipes car c’est une force pour le collectif et un vecteur d’innovation.Nous sommes une entreprise handi-accueillante : n'hésitez pas à nous faire part de vos besoins spécifiques.

About the job
            
 
Digitalisiere die GKVWir digitalisieren und vernetzen für das Wichtigste im Leben – Gesundheit. Es gibt kaum ein spannenderes Zukunftsfeld als die IT. Und kein wertvolleres als die Gesundheit. Verbinde beide Themen und mache daraus eine Karriere, bei der sich die Frage nach der Sinnhaftigkeit gar nicht erst stellt. Unterstütze uns dabei, Kunden zu beraten, Prozesse zu sichern und Teams zu organisieren. Unser Business entwickelt sich stetig weiter – mit uns kannst du das auch. Deine Projekte – das machst du bei uns: Gestalte und optimiere Prozesse für den Datenaustausch der größten Datendrehscheibe der GKV.Begleite den kompletten Lebenszyklus von eigenentwickelten Anwendungen und Plattformen für den synchronen und asynchronen Datenaustausch und entwickle diese im Team weiter.Plane und entwickle neue innovative Plattformen für den Datenaustausch auch im Cloud-Kontext.Die Störungsanalyse und Dokumentation im Datenaustausch ist ein wichtiger Bestandteil
Unsere Benefits – das bieten wir dir: Branche mit Zukunft: Bei uns arbeitest du in zwei Zukunftsmärkten – IT und Gesundheit. Fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung: Mit unserer Personalentwicklung hast du die Chance, dich fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln. Gutes Betriebsklima und Netzwerk: Teamwork wird bei uns großgeschrieben! Wir arbeiten gerne zusammen, egal von welchem Standort aus. Freiräume und Zeit für Regeneration: Wer Leistung bringen will, muss sich wohlfühlen. Wir arbeiten in einer 39-Stunden Woche, haben flexible Arbeitszeiten und bieten dir 30 Tage Urlaub. Wir legen sogar noch 3 weitere betriebsfreie Tage oben drauf. Gesundheitsmanagement: Um gute Ideen zu haben, braucht es einen freien Kopf. Gesundheits-Camp oder Firmenlauf sind nur zwei Angebote unseres Gesundheitsmanagements. Moderne Hard-/Software: Werde ein Teil unseres agilen und offenen Teams und nutze die neuesten Technologien für deine Arbeit.Benefits: Bei uns ist deine tarifliche Vergütung gesichert. Dazu gibt es Firmentickets, eine Sabbatical-Regelung, JobRad-Leasing, Kindergartenzuschuss und viele weitere Vorteile.
 Dein Background – das bringst du mit: Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering unter Einsatz von Apache Nifi, im Datenaustausch und in der Entwicklung von Schnittstellen macht dich zum Profi.Kenntnisse in folgenden Programmiersprachen (Bsp.: Python, Groovy)REST, SOAP, https und JSON, Linux Shell-Skript, AWK, SQL, sind keine Fremdworte für dich.Du hast den Mut, dich und deine Motivation auch bei fehlenden Teil-Qualifizierungen bei uns vorzustellen. Rufbereitschaften in einem rollierenden System sind kein Problem für Dich.
Jedes Bit macht Gesundheit smart.

job_title: Data Engineer | Amsterdam | tot 78k | Greenfield omgeving
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Wil jij je stempel drukken bij het creëren van een compleet nieuw data landschap?Ben jij iemand die goed weet wat er moet gebeuren en niet bang is voor verantwoordelijkheid?Zoek jij naar een snelgroeiende omgeving waar veel uitdagingen op je pad zullen komen?Zou jij het gaaf vinden om de kern van de groei op het gebied van data te zijn binnen een verbindende organisatie die ook internationaal een steeds grotere rol speelt?
 Lees dan snel verder over jouw nieuwe uitdaging als Data Engineer! Over jouw nieuwe werkgeverWat hebben de Hogeschool van Amsterdam, een internationale kunstverzameling, een Covid-19 testcentrum en jaarlijks 1,5 miljoen klanten met elkaar gemeen? Je raad het nooit, maar deze toffe organisatie! Ruim 125 jaar geleden werd deze organisatie opgericht in de hoofdstad van Nederland. Hier verzorgen zij voor hun klanten de publieke en verbindende functie en helpen zij dagelijks aan creatieve oplossingen. Hoe het gister was, is morgen weer helemaal anders, deze dynamische organisatie is niet van het stilzitten en wil van data continu kunnen leren.Ruim 350 medewerkers op het hoofdkantoor werken gezamenlijk aan het doel om de belangen van hun klanten voorop te zetten en denken zij dagelijks mee over steeds betere concepten en oplossingen. Hoewel de organisatie al 125 jaar bestaat, is de organisatie nog jong van hart. Met veel werknemers die een Hotelschool achtergrond hebben, mag je er zeker van zijn dat naast de dagelijkse werkzaamheden gezelligheid centraal staat.De organisatie is helemaal data (aan)gedreven. Hierin onmisbaar geworden is hun Data en Analytics Platform. Dit platform en jouw werk is essentieel om structuur te brengen in de oplossingen die aan de 1,5 jaarlijkse klanten worden aangeboden.Over jouw nieuwe rol als Data Engineer Jij zal je voornamelijk bezighouden met het verzamelen, transformeren en laden van data zodat deze gebruikt kunnen worden voor een verbeterde besluitvorming. Je zal geheel op je eigen manier vorm mogen geven aan een compleet nieuw data landschap. Data is namelijk iets wat nog niet veel gebruikt werd binnen deze operationele organisatie tot een paar jaar geleden, en jij kan hiermee direct impact maken voor de groeiende toekomst van dit bedrijf en jouw carrière. Je bent voortdurend op zoek naar nieuwe technologieën en methodieken om de data-architectuur te verbeteren. Daarnaast stuur je een sterke Data Analytics & Engineering consultancy aan op de inhoud. Daarnaast ben je een onmisbare schakel in het inrichten van een gloednieuw Data & Analytics Platform. Je gaat data pipelines maken en door middel van het sterke Azure Synapse platform zal je de data transformeren en klaar zetten. Je krijgt de kans om juniors te begeleiden en uiteindelijk een eigen datateam te creëren. Jij draagt direct bij in het ervoor zorgen dat deze organisatie data gedreven gaat worden en je krijgt de kans om dit volledig op je eigen manier in te richten!  Wie ben jij? Naast sterke technische skills ben je ook communicatief een uitblinker en weet je goed externe bureaus aan te sturen die je gaan helpen in het bereiken van een succesvolle Data Engineering omgeving;Je hebt ongeveer 5 jaar ervaring in een Data Engineering of Business Intellingence positie;Je hebt ervaring in git development (DTAP);Je hebt kennis van de agile werkwijze;Je hebt ervaring met CI/CD (Azure DevOps is een pré);Je hebt ervaring met tooling zoals: Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lakehouse en T-SQL.
 Wat krijg je daarvoor terug? Bijdragen aan het succes van een bedrijf wat met jouw hulp meer datagedreven wilt worden;Bij een sterke marktleider de kans krijgen om ze ook op het gebied van data een sterspeler te maken;Het coördineren van verschillende migraties van on prem naar de cloud;Goed salaris tot ongeveer 6.000,- op basis van 40 uur, afhankelijk van senioriteit en werkervaring;Mogelijkheid tot 32-urige werkweek;Flexibele werktijden en –plekken;Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals 25 vakantiedagen met 13 ADV dagen, ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden, een goede pensioenregeling en een winstdeling.

About the job
            
 
Descriptif de l’entreprise :​Meritis est un cabinet de conseil, pilotage et développement IT fondé en 2007 présent à Paris, Sophia-Antipolis, Aix-en-Provence, Montpellier, Toulouse, Nantes... Et bientôt sur de nouveaux territoires ! Notre mission ? Connecter les meilleurs talents aux entreprises pour leur donner un temps d’avance.​Nous accompagnons nos clients dans l’intégralité de leurs besoins en transformation numérique à travers de nombreux domaines d’expertises : Software Engineering, Finance, Pilotage de projets, Devops, Data, Cloud, Cybersécurité ou encore Agilité.​Intervenant aussi bien dans les secteurs de la Banque, de l'Assurance, des Télécommunications que de l'Industrie ou des Transports, aujourd'hui 40% des entreprises du CAC40 sont clientes Meritis.​Fort de nos valeurs d’exigence, d’humilité, de bienveillance et de proximité, nous comptons aujourd’hui plus de 900 collaborateurs.​Nous mettons un point d’honneur à être proche de nos collaborateurs et à les accompagner de manière individualisée quelles que soient leurs fonctions dans l’entreprise.Certifiée Great Place To Work depuis 2013, notre conception du bien-être au travail va bien au-delà d'un simple label, ce sont nos collaborateurs qui en parlent le mieux : https://www.glassdoor.fr/Avis/Meritis-Avis-E1163008.htm.​Nous recherchons un Data Engineer Spark/Scala H/F, ayant au moins 4 ans d'expérience, pour intervenir chez notre client leader du secteur du retail, pour les accompagner dans l'établissement d'une stratégie de gestion de données ambitieuse pour le groupe et ses marques en développant des données et des pipelines de donnéesVos missions : Créer et maintenir une architecture optimale de pipeline de données Assembler de grands ensembles de données complexes qui répondent aux besoins fonctionnels / non fonctionnels de l’entrepriseConstruire l’infrastructure requise pour optimiser l’extraction, la transformation et le chargement de données provenant de sources très diverses au moyen des technologies « big data » SQL et AWS Travailler avec les Data Scientists et l’IT pour résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux données et répondre à leurs besoins d’infrastructure de donnéesTravailler avec les experts en analyse de données pour améliorer la fonctionnalité des systèmes de données
Ce poste est à pourvoir en CDIEnvironnement technique : Framework : SparkLangages de programmation : Scala, Python, SQLBases de données : NoSQL, Teradata,...Cloud : AWS (EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift)
Ce poste est-il fait pour vous ? : Vous êtes diplômé d'un Bac +5 et justifiez d'au moins 4 ans d'expérience en tant que Data EngineerVous avez de l'expérience sur les outils Python, SQL Server et avez de l'expérience sur GCPVous parlez anglais courammentVous avez une passion pour le domaine de la Data et souhaitez monter en compétences
Vos différences sont nos atouts. C’est pourquoi Meritis est engagée en faveur de la diversité et de la non-discrimination. Tous nos métiers sont accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap. Si vous avez une question ou pensez être victime ou témoin d’une discrimination, vous pouvez contacter ethiquegroup@meritis.fr. »

About the job
            
 
If you have: · Graduate degree in Mathematics or Computer Science, - Bachelor degree· Good proficiency, knowledge and experience using Oracle PL/SQL Programming, BI Analytic (Oracle) or Power BI· Ability to meet deadlines and prioritize tasks· Teamwork skills· Willingness to develop your skills· Attention to detail, ability to work with large data sets· Good analytical, organizational and communication skills· Previous work experience in banking is an advantage And you want to:· You work Agile· Based on the business requirements and functional specification, develop reports or data files in Warehouse (DWH)· Create reports/dashboards in BI Analytics and BI Publisher (Oracle) according to local and group regulator or business requirements via Oracle PL/SQL Developer· Run and update/modify redefined reports in Excel, Access, SAS, PowerBI· Track existing reports and update them as needed· Actively participate in testing of changed and new data in BI Analytics and BI Publisher· Deliver reports on time as required Here you will find:· Excellent opportunities for professional and career development in the largest financial group in Bulgaria· Remuneration commensurate with the responsibilities of the post· Diverse opportunities to learn and improve knowledge and skills· Preferential conditions for the use of products and services of all companies, part of the CBC in Bulgaria Supplementary health insurance· Life/ Accident Insurance· Food vouchers worth 80 BGN per month· Bonus for recommending a job candidate· Additional payment for an important personal event· Ability to work from home and Flexible working hours· 25 days paid annual leave· Preferential fee for the use of a sports card· Participation in a solidarity fund that supports employees and their families in times of need Share your future with us! Submit your CV using the apply button below the advert.Candidates approved on the documents will be invited for an interview.Confidentiality is assured and the data provided is under special protection under the PDPA.More about us: The Belgian KBC Group is the largest banking and insurance group in Bulgaria. KBC Group in Bulgaria brings together companies with a long history and extensive experience. The companies that are part of the KBC Group in Bulgaria are United Bulgarian Bank, DZI General Insurance, DZI Life Insurance, UBB Interlease, UBB Pension Insurance, UBB Asset Management, UBB Factoring, UBB Insurance Broker, KBC Branch Bulgaria. They offer a full range of financial services including leasing, asset management and factoring.UBB was established in 1992 through the merger of 22 Bulgarian regional commercial banks.By consistently following our corporate values, we want to be a benchmark in banking by putting the interests of our customers at the centre of our business, achieving sustainable and profitable growth by fulfilling our role in society.

About the job
            
 
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer with Service NowSeniority: Mid (3-5 years)Type of position: Hybrid from Lisbon. Candidates must be in Portugal already!The amazing you, will have: This role involves a Data Engineer responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data infrastructure for IT Asset and Configuration Management.The responsibilities include working with large datasets, developing data pipelines, defining local operations and processes for IT Asset Management and Configuration Management, and ensuring data quality.You should have over 5 years of experience in Software Asset Management, expertise in ServiceNow design and data modeling, database and spreadsheet skills, and be proficient in stakeholder management, business and data analysis. The deliverables encompass managing data infrastructure, optimizing data processes, aligning architecture with business needs, improving data quality, and supporting IT Asset Management programs.Fluency in English.Hybrid 2x onsite
Why should you become part of our family? Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!
Who are we? Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the top 10 big companies in the “Excellence Index”, an initiative which aims to reward the organizations that invest the most in the development

job_title: Full-Stack Python Developer – Frankfurt – Up to €95k
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Full-Stack Python Developer – Frankfurt – Up to €95kAfter an incredibly successful past few years, one of my clients are looking once again to expand their development team in Frankfurt. Recently releasing their second payment gateway designed for businesses, there are a lot of plans the company have to continue their growth/success.After already doubling their staff in the past year they are looking to continue this trend over the next 12 months, and you could be a part of this amazing story.With an international team who are passionate about technology, it’s a great opportunity to keep progressing your career and even a chance to move into a leading position if you so desire.What is required: 5+ years of professional experience with Python and JavascriptStrong knowledge with Django and MongoDB/MySQLExcellent experinece with FastAPI or FlaskGood background in frontend frameworks such as React, Angular or VueFamiliar working with Docker containersPast experience working in the FinTech industry is a great plusFluent English

This is a fantastic opportunity for any experienced full-stack developer who is looking to join a growing company who can offer chances for progression into lead spaces in the immediate/near future.For any questions or further information, just send your details and/or resume to: abrennan@optimussearch.com

About the job
            
 
💠Freelance Snowflake Data Engineer Required💠My client is a Data service provider in the Netherlands, they're looking for a Freelancer to assist with their pre-existing project with an end client of theirs.You'll be bringing your Snowflake knowledge to the table, the ability to share this knowledge and lead teams will be invaluable to the client.In terms of skills:💠Snowflake💠Azure💠Demonstrable lead experience💠SnowPro Certification is an advantageDetails:💠Hybrid - The Hague💠16-24 hours per week💠3 Month contract (minimum 3-month extension)Interested? Let me know!🇳🇱 +31 20 808 5278🇬🇧 +44 117 248 2000📧 jack.webb@foxtekrs.com

About the job
            
 
About Ingrid Capacity Ingrid Capacity facilitates the electrification of society and the transition to renewable energy as the leading Nordic actor in building large-scale energy storages. We are in a rapid growth phase with a historic expansion of energy storage in Sweden while also expanding internationally. We expect to continue to grow rapidly in the coming years, by scaling both in new geographies and new technologies of flexible energy assets.Do you want to join our exciting journey and contribute to the green energy transition? Electrification and the transition to renewable energy create fantastic opportunities – for us as individuals, as a company and for society at large.About the role As Data Engineer, you will join our growing team and work closely with analysts, engineers and cross functionally with other stakeholders at Ingrid Capacity. Your main focus will be to build and run data pipelines, data warehouses and data frameworks as well as develop our data platform and architecture as a whole. You will be a key part of making our data reliable and structured as well as understandable and available to the organization. As a person, we believe that you enjoy a dynamic, flexible and fast-growing environment where you will have great opportunities to give direct input and shape our ways of working. Since our team and Ingrid Capacity as a company is growing, this is a great opportunity to make an impact. Key tasks and responsibilities:  Building and running scalable data pipelines. Ensuring that data is collected, structured and stored correctly and efficiently. Ensuring that relevant data and insights are made available to the rest of the organization. Working with data governance, data quality and data validation. Work closely with the rest of the team to ensure that our data services are optimized within the organization as a whole, from internal analysis to forecasting and optimization of products.
To be a good match with the role, we believe that you have:  Previous work experience in software development, as Data Engineer or similar. Experience in designing, implementing and maintaining ETL pipelines. Experience in working with cloud infrastructure, preferably Google Cloud Platform. Knowledge in SQL and Python. Fluency in English, written and verbal. Degree in Computer Science or similar, or comparable work experience. 
In addition, the following is highly meritorious:  Knowledge of Airflow. Knowledge of BigQuery. Experience in working with time series data. Experience in working with log and alert systems. Experience from the energy industry or related field, containing energy related data such as weather, technical or financial. 
How Ingrid Capacity facilitates the green transition As our societies become more electrified and switch to climate-smart and renewable energy, both great opportunities and challenges arise. Energy storage is necessary to manage the electrification, and electrification is necessary to manage the climate challenge. Large-scale battery energy storage will be a key part of the energy infrastructure of the future. Our storages take care of electricity when there is surplus, then tapping it back to the system when there is shortage. Right now, we are laying out a historic expansion of energy storage in Sweden. At Ingrid Capacity, we are therefore not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We are at the forefront of the global energy transition, dedicated to reshaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation, where we dare to push boundaries and turn bold ideas into reality. ApplicationSounds like a match? Welcome to apply! We’ll make selections on an ongoing basis and finalize the recruitment as soon as we’ve found the perfect match. Having said that, please don’t wait to submit your application. Our recruitment partner UrbanUrban manages the process and lead recruiter is Lina Dobrzynski (lina@urbanurban.se). Please note that we do not accept applications via email, only through the link above/below. We look forward to hearing from you!

About the job
            
 
From ideas to impactWe are a global digital business services organization with a mission to improve the way people and companies work. Forever. Our Consulting, Delivery and Learning teams design and deliver transformational digital products and experiences that add value to our clients’ businesses and to their customers' lives.Every day, across the world, our teams are pioneering faster, better ways to bring our client’s most exciting ideas to life.Do you enjoy building products that really make a difference?If you are Senior Data Engineer, then you might be just who we're looking for to help us shape Emergn exciting future and play an important role in our growth.We want you to join the team on an exciting and challenging client engagement.We want you to: Work on large scale projects in data analytics /data warehousing areaDevelop SQL / ETL solutions in tax administration areaPrepare necessary documentation
This job might be for you if you have: Experienced in SQL DB and SQLAdvanced SQL userExperienced in PythonCan write queries, knows database performance optimization approaches, capable of designing highly available and performant database structuresExcellent communication skills, also with customer stakeholdersHas experience as system analyst, is able to gather requirements, describe to be state and define tasks
We offer: Salary: 4200 - 4500€ gross per monthHealth insurance (right after probation period)Life and disability insurance (right after probation period)Work within a dynamic international team of expertsExcellent opportunity for personal and professional developmentComfortable office and flexible working hoursAbility to work from home and all the tools you’ll need for workHuge catalog of educational programs, the possibility of training and certification at the expense of the companyFriendly environment
The best part:We help some of the world’s most respected businesses—including Fortune 500, FTSE 100 and Global 2000 companies develop and deliver their most promising ideas into valuable digital products and customer experiences faster. Emergn offers product innovation, enterprise transformation, experience design, product development, intelligent automation, and data and analytics capabilities. Through our educational platform VFQ, the industry’s only work-based learning approach to scaled digital transformation, we help global enterprises and individual learners alike build agility into their way of working and deliver value at pace.With us, you’re a part of a diverse international community of friendly, supportive experts, working and sharing without borders.Here, you can push boundaries through challenging and varied work for some of the world’s most respected international businesses.You’ll get to work with the latest technologies and innovative working practices through our VFQ philosophy and culture of continuous learning.Work where you’ll make an impact every day.Join us today!

About the job
            
 
Opportunité Passionnante pour un Data Engineer Senior (CDI) !Pour une équipe innovante au sein d'une entreprise dynamique, leader dans son domaine, nous recherchons activement un Data Engineer Senior.Responsabilités :Concevoir, développer et maintenir des pipelines de données robustes et évolutifs, de l'acquisition à la mise à disposition pour l'analyse.Collaborer avec les équipes métier pour comprendre les besoins en matière de données et créer des solutions adaptées.Optimiser les architectures de données existantes et identifier les opportunités d'amélioration continue.Mettre en place des processus de qualité et de gouvernance des données pour assurer la fiabilité et la sécurité des informations.Compétences Requises :Expérience avérée : 5+ ans en tant que Data Engineer, avec une expertise démontrée dans la conception et la mise en œuvre de solutions de données scalables.Maîtrise technique : Expertise en technologies de traitement des données telles que Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, ainsi que des outils de gestion de flux de données.Langages de programmation : Solides compétences en Python, Java, Scala et expérience pratique avec des bases de données SQL et NoSQL.Modélisation et manipulation de données : Connaissance approfondie des pratiques de modélisation et de manipulation de données ainsi que des concepts de data warehouse et de data lake.Cloud et Big Data : Expérience dans l'utilisation de plateformes cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) pour les solutions Big Data.Outils d'orchestration : Expertise dans des outils d'orchestration de workflows comme Airflow ou Luigi.Compétences en Data Science : Connaissance des principes de Data Science, analyse exploratoire des données (EDA), et utilisation d'algorithmes d'apprentissage automatique pour la manipulation des données.Visualisation des données : Expérience avec des outils de visualisation comme Tableau, Power BI, ou matplotlib/Seaborn pour Python.Qualités interpersonnelles : Capacité à travailler de manière autonome tout en collaborant efficacement au sein d'équipes multidisciplinaires.Communication : Maîtrise du français (à l'oral et à l'écrit) indispensable, toute autre langue est un plus.Si vous êtes passionné par l'exploitation des données pour générer des insights et que vous possédez ces compétences techniques avancées ainsi qu'une compréhension des concepts de Data Science, n'hésitez pas à me contacter

job_title: (Senior) Data/Cloud Engineer (f/m/d) Analytics & AI - Expert Services
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Job DescriptionDo you love data and technology? Do you think we all need to become more sustainable? Are you ready to drive and boost the green energy transition? Then this is the right job for you. Your energy shapes the future! Being aware of the enormous responsibility we have for our customers, our assets, and the environment, we are analyzing and developing solutions, utilizing advanced big data and machine learning technologies to provide the best service, improve the efficiency and make things smarter, better, and cleaner.Your impact You team-up with our scientists, business and infrastructure experts to design data solutions that have global impact and scale to all E.ON countriesYou build and maintain efficient and scalable data pipelines that ensure data quality, accuracy, and reliabilityYou stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends and apply this knowledge to continuously improve our data pipelinesYou ensure high quality and stability through agile processes and peer code reviewsYou share your ideas and convince to go new ways
Qualifications You should have a bachelors degree in computer science or a related fieldYou should have at least 2 years of experience in data engineering, at least 5 for a senior positionYou have good or excellent knowledge with Microsoft AzureYou have a good understanding and knowledge of Python programming language, its concepts, and its associated frameworksYou have experience in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines using tools such as Azure Data Factory and DatabricksYou should have experience with software development best practices, including version control, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD), monitoring, automation, and testingYou should have experience in Infrastructure-as-a-Code as well as building secure cloud architecturesIdeally you have experience working with data lakes and its conceptsIdeally you have a strong understanding of SQL and NoSQL databasesExperience with Kubernetes and containerization is a plusFinished Azure Certifications are a plusIdeally you have already experience with machine learning (data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, model selection)Excellent writing and communication skills, considering varying levels of precision and matching the audienceFluent in English; German language skills are seen as a plus
What you can expect from a Career in E.ON Digital TechnologyWe offer the unique opportunity to combine your love for technology with your passion to work on a topic of high relevance for society. You will be able to contribute to E.ONs ambitious digitalization strategy, to apply and broaden your expertise on a variety of assignments, to work with cutting edge technology and to have the opportunity to grow your career internationally across the wider organization.InclusionIt is important to us that people with disabilities have access to a fair application process, providing them with an opportunity to shine. Therefore, our representative body for severely disabled people will be included in the process from an early stage. Please let us know via the application form if you require technical or organisational adjustments during the application process. We will strive to make the required aids available.Should you not be able to apply online and want to speak someone in person, please contact your local recruiter.

Oracle Data Integration)Erfahrung in der Datenbankentwicklung (Oracle)Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und PL/SQLErgebnisorientiertes Arbeiten und QualitätsbewusstseinSelbständiger Arbeitsstil, Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit
