About the job
            
 
Join the Future of Sustainability as a Data Engineer!Data EngineerUp to €70.000 yearlyRotterdam, The NetherlandsCompany:This company is committed to leading the charge towards a fully sustainable business landscape. In the face of climate change, our mission is clear - we develop and deliver data-driven solutions empowering vessel owners and industry stakeholders to significantly reduce their carbon footprint.The role:The company is paving the way for a sustainable future, and you could be a key player in this journey. We're on the lookout for a talented Data Engineer to help modernize our IT architecture, database platform (including data warehouse and APIs), and internal processes. Your role will be pivotal in shaping our digital landscape.Your Responsibilities: Design, implement, and support a secure platform for accessing large datasets, utilizing Azure and SQL.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and define data requirements.Identify and resolve data issues using quality and profiling tools.Contribute to data migration, integration, and MDM projects.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, reliable, and scalable data solutions.
What We're Looking For: We need a creative problem-solver with a knack for data engineering and a passion for sustainability. Here's what we're seeking: Demonstrable experience in data engineering and related projects.Familiarity with MS SQL Server, and bonus points for NoSQL databases.Knowledge of Axway Policy Studio is a plus.Understanding of solution architecture and Azure.Familiarity with machine learning languages (e.g., R, Python, Java).Interest in and understanding of improving business processes.
Our Offer to You: In addition to being part of our sustainable mission, we offer a competitive package, including: Competitive Base SalaryBonusesPremium-free pension50% Compensation for medical expensesMinimum of 29 days annual leaveProfessional and personal development opportunities
Join us in leading the way for sustainable solutions!If you're ready to be at the forefront of driving sustainability through innovative data solutions, we want to hear from you!

About the job
            
 
InVivo Digital Factory est le pôle digital du groupe InVivo, 1er groupe coopératif agricole français. Sa mission depuis 2018 : piloter et exécuter la transformation digitale du groupe et de l’ensemble de ses métiers BtoB et BtoC stratégiques (Agriculture, Vin, Retail / Jardinerie et distribution alimentaire et Malterie).Parmi ces grands projets de développement est né une Success story : aladin.farm, 1er projet digital développé par l’entreprise en 2019. Plateforme de vente des produits et services agricoles des coopératives d’ InVivo, aladin.farm est le fruit de la collaboration avec 9 coopératives sociétaires ayant pour projet de digitaliser la commercialisation de leurs approvisionnements auprès de leurs agriculteurs. En 2022, trois ans après son lancement, aladin.farm à franchi le cap du million d’articles agricoles vendus en ligne pour un CA de plus de 150 M €.En 2021 s’ouvre une nouvelle page pour InVivo Digital Factory qui s’attaque alors au marché BtoC avec le vaste projet de refonte des sites e-commerce de Teract, branche Retail d’InVivo : Jardiland.com et Gammvert.fr.🔎A quoi va ressembler ton quotidien ?Au sein des équipes Digital Factory du Groupe InVivo, vous prenez en charge la collecte des données issues de sources et de volumétries variées (systèmes d’information traditionnel ou No SQL, systèmes de production, IoT, log, Events, …). Vous assurez la connectivité vers les différentes sources, analysez le modèle des données sources et comprenez les problématiques métier afin de définir une modélisation adéquate des DataSets. Vous prenez en charge la transformation de ces données (nettoyage, normalisation, et préparation), pour y appliquer les traitements analytiques conçus par les Data Scientists, ou les traitements décisionnels conçus par les Data Analysts.En tant que sénior de l’équipe Data Engineering, vous assurez la relation avec les PO et apportez, au reste de l’équipe, votre maîtrise des architectures de flux de données, votre expérience sur la qualité des flux et des données ainsi que sur la sécurité. Vous participez activement à l’acculturation des métiers.Les locaux de la Digital Factory sont basés à La Défense. Télétravail à hauteur de 60%.🐱‍🏍Les missions Recueillir les besoins en données (Data Product Owner, Data Analysts, Data Scientists) et analyser les sources de données, identifier de nouvelles sources de données pertinentes.Coordonner la mise en place de l’architecture Data & Analytics, conçue avec le data architect et en garantir le bon fonctionnement, la disponibilité, l’évolution et la performance technique des outilsDévelopper les pipelines d’intégration de donnée et la data quality en collaboration avec les Data Product Owner, Data Analysts et Data ScientistsGarantir l’industrialisation et l’automatisation de la chaîne de valeur de la donnée, en y intégrant les algorithmes décisionnels et les modèles de prédiction des donnéesEffectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions et participer activement à l’effort R&DContribuer à l’évolution des pratiques dans son domaine de compétences, en étant actif dans des réseaux de veille
Profil recherché👨‍🎓 De formation Bac+5 école d’ingénieur orienté développement, ou master spécialisé en data, avec une spécialisation Big Data, vous êtes passionné.e par l’innovation et les technologies liées aux domaines Data Analytics & AI. Vous avez une expérience d’au moins 5 ans sur un poste similaire.Vous faites preuve d’une grande capacité d’adaptation et capacité à communiquer avec des interlocuteurs multiples.🎭 Vous êtes rigoureux.se, curieux.se, force de proposition, vous avez un bon esprit d’analyse et de synthèse. Reduces the risk of errors, improves consistency, and streamlines operations.Optimization: Regularly assess processes, gather feedback from team members, and implement improvements to respond to changing needs.Data-Driven Decision-Making: Utilize data and analytics to provide objective guidance to obtain the most significant impactAlignment with customers to embrace a perfect data integration: Tailor your interactions and services to each customer's preferences and needs using data and insights to personalized experiences.Embrace multiple channels to communicate with customers effectively.Implement systems and processes to proactively identify and resolve issues before they impact the data integration experience.Stay updated with relevant technological trends and advancements for the team.Design, develop, maintain and evolve the data stack to answer both business and product needs (especially back end features within the platform)Build data pipelines and configure the platform (incl. algorithms) to on-board new customers.

About the job
            
 
About Us  Making Science is a leading digital marketing and technology consulting firm, that is listed in the Madrid Stock Exchange. We are currently expanding our operations internationally, and our offices are located in Madrid, Barcelona, Lisboa, París, Mexico City, Milan, and Dublin. We are a company that specializes in providing comprehensive marketing and technological solutions for digital businesses. Our team is composed of more than 1000 digital native professionals, who have a wide knowledge in the different stages and disciplines of the digital transformation: Digital Strategy, Infrastructures, Software Development, Creativity and UX/UI Design, Digital Marketing, and Big Data.  Making Science is People Centric, and we actively bet on our employees! We believe that they are the key to any successful business, and therefore, our greatest asset. We strive to provide daily learning opportunities for those who work with us and their colleagues. It is also really important that they enjoy what they do, and have positive experiences. We want our employees to feel proud of their accomplishments, and that they belong to a company that is in constant growth, because each person’s contribution is essential to achieve our success. Do you want to be part of this great family?
What We’d Like You To DoThe selected candidate will join our project team, working closely with one of our most prominent clients in the insurance sector. This collaborative team includes other data engineers from Making Science. Your primary responsibility will involve transforming the existing ad-hoc data processing on Google Cloud Platform into a more efficiently designed set of data processing pipelines and workflows.What We’d Like You To Bring  Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience. Proficiency in Python and SQL. Strong familiarity with Airflow / Cloud Composer, Docker, GIT, and ETL/ELT design patterns. Hands-on development experience in Google Cloud Platform, including Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, BigQuery, with a plus for expertise in Dataflow, DJango, and Terraform. Google Cloud Platform certifications are a definite advantage.
Nice To Have  Proficiency in Castellano (Spanish) is essential. Knowledge of English is a plus. A degree in Computer Science or a related field. Residency in Madrid is required.
Perks of joining us  We give you complete stability with an indefinite job contract. We offer a fixed salary according to your worth and experience, plus a performance based bonus.  Get the most out of your salary with our Flexible Payment Plan (Restaurant Ticket, Transportation Ticket, Day Care Ticket, and Medical Insurance. Do you know someone that fits in Making Science? Refer him or her, and you can get a bonus if they’re hired! Feedback is part of our day to day lives. We recognize a job well done through a continuous feedback model.  We care about a healthy work-life balance. You can count on having flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home.  You will never stop learning with us: subsidized training, free language classes, learning capsules, an e-learning platform, and many more. Pack your bags, you’ll have 26 vacation days!  Work comfortably and follow your own style, because we don’t have a dress code.  We know how to have a good time! Monthly TGIF events, 5V, and much more! Never go hungry with our free daily fruit and our vending machine card! Take a break on our terrace, play foosball, darts, or PlayStation Be a part of a young, adventurous, and professional team, with people you’ll grow fond of!
We are waiting for you!

About the job
            
 
The Role and purpose of the Data Management Engineer is to act as the AMOS Data Management liaison between Fleet Performance, Airline Technology, Data Science, and IT. Coordinating the data landscape and providing AMOS Data from the live and Replica AMOS Servers through to the point of use within reporting tools such as Tableau and or internal and external modelling applications. Either directly or via the AWS Snowflake Database.As a member of the multi-disciplinary AMOS Competency Centre this role is responsible for providing AMOS data, and as such will require an in-depth knowledge of the use and extraction of AMOS data tables required to be imported into peripheral systems. All AMOS data transfer and manipulation is to be fully compliant with Company and regulatory policies with particular attention to the safe handling of personal data. The role is to ensure the safety and integrity of the AMOS core systems and data, and the use and audit of AMOS data in peripheral applications.This role has a requirement for regular European travel.About The RoleAs Systems Development and Procedure Engineer you’ll be responsible for:  Liaison and focal point between E&M and Analytics team Collaborative set up of Data Marts Coordination and alignment of requirements & data requests/ compliance Support data analysis across E&M and with special focus on Fleet Performance Subject matter expert, providing systems Data and development expertise. Analyse, evaluate and improve existing business processes and procedures for users and interfaces with Fleet Performance, Data Analytics, Data Science, and IT.
About You  In depth knowledge of the AMOS Data Table Structure Experience working with AMOS / within Amos Competency Center Knowledge of SQL or similar query language Understanding of relational databases Sound project management ability and process experience Strong IT skills and experience of planning and implementing systems development and deployment A logical thinker with the ability to generate ideas and alternatives Demonstrable ability to clearly articulate concepts and arguments verbally and in written documentation
About Our Offer Fantastic holiday benefits including discounts, special offers and the ability to purchase additional ‘TUI time off’Health and Wellbeing support in five key areas – Financial, Health, Social, Community and CareerDiscretionary Bonus SchemeExcellent rates with foreign exchangePension scheme and life assurance.
At TUI, we know people are as diverse as the destinations we send our customers to.We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit our Smile page Click here

About the job
            
 
We work in a hybrid model! Recruitment process for this position is conducted online.Software Center jest częścią Grupy Capgemini.Wspieramy naszych klientów, wykorzystując wiedzę, doświadczenie i zaangażowanie naszych specjalistów. Nasze biura znajdują się we Wrocławiu, Poznaniu i Gdańsku. Realizujemy projekty z wielu branż — od logistycznej, motoryzacyjnej, rozrywkowej, po publiczną i chemiczną. Jesteśmy ekspertami w wielu technologiach, tj. Java, Cloud, .NET, React czy testowanie.Department DescriptionInsights & Data practice delivers cutting-edge data centric solutions.Most of our projects are Cloud & Big Data engineering. We develop solutions to process large, also unstructured, datasets, with dedicated Cloud Data services on AWS, Azure or GCP.We are responsible for full SDLC of the solution: apart from using data processing tools (e.g., ETL), we code a lot in Python, Scala or Java and use DevOps tools and best practices. The data is either exposed to downstream systems via API, outbound interfaces or visualized on reports and dashboards.Within our AI CoE we deliver Data Science and Machine Learning projects with focus on NLP, Anomaly Detection and Computer Vision.Additionally, we are exploring the area of Quantum Computing, searching for practical growth opportunities for both us and our clients.Currently, over 250 of our Data Architects, Engineers and Scientists work on exciting projects for over 30 clients from different sectors (Financial Services, Logistics, Automotive, Telco and others)Come on Board!Your Future Tasks design and implementation of solutions processing large and unstructured datasets (Data Mesh , Data Lake or Streaming Architecture);implementation, optimization and testing of modern DWH/Big Data solutions based on AWS cloud platform and Continuous Delivery / Continuous Integration environment;data processing efficiency improvement, migrations from on-prem to public cloud platforms.
Frequently Used Technologies AWS CloudPython/ PySparkGlueRedshiftSnowflakeSQLTerraform
Our Requirements at least 3 years of experience in Big Data or Cloud projects in the areas of processing and visualization of large and unstructured datasets (in different phases of Software Development Life Cycle);practical knowledge of the AWS cloud in Storage, Compute (+Serverless), Networtking and DevOps areas supported by commercial project work experience;theoretical AWS cloud knowledge supported with certificates (for example DVA-C01, SAA-C02, SAP-C01, VDS-C01, DAS-C01);familiarity with several of the following technologies: Glue, Redshift, Lambda, Athena, S3, Snowflake, Docker, Terraform, CloudFormation, Kafka, Airflow, Spark;At least basic knowledge of one of this programming languages: Python/Scala/Java/bash;Very good command of English (German language would be an advantage).
What have we prepared for you? permanent employment contract from the first day;hybrid, flexible working model;equipment package for home office;private medical care and life insurance;access to our NAIS benefit platform;possibility of using increased tax-deductible costs in the case of creative work.
Personal And Professional Development 70+ training tracks with certification opportunities (e.g., MS Azure, AWS, Google) on our NEXT training platform.Platform with free access to Pluralsight, TED TalksCoursera materials and trainings.Free access to Udemy Business account with ability to use during and outside working hours.
Would you like to discover a world of unlimited possibilities and continuous innovation? At Capgemini, we're proud to be a global leader in working with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. We are guided everyday by the purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future.It's time to #Get the Future You Want!Your life is in your hands, and you have the opportunity to improve it, develop yourself, and simply — join us!Do you want to get to know us better? Visit our Capgemini Software website!Do you have any additional questions about working at Capgemini?Check Our Instagram — @capgeminipl Facebook profile — Capgemini Polska.You can also find us on TikTok! — @capgeminipl.

Company OverviewMy client is a dynamic and innovative company specialising in creating world-class data platforms and data-driven solutions for our clients. We work on challenging projects in diverse industries and domains, utilising the latest methods and technologies to deliver exceptional results. Our collaborative and supportive team environment encourages continuous learning and professional growth.Job DescriptionAs a Data Solutions Developer at my client, you will be a key contributor in the implementation of cloud data platforms and the development of data solutions. You will work collaboratively with a team of developers, designers, data scientists, and clients to clarify requirements, define the best approach, and collectively shape the end product.Key Responsibilities  Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to clarify complex requirements, determine the optimal path forward, and collectively influence the final result. Contribute to the implementation of cloud data platforms, selecting the most suitable technologies and ensuring continuous delivery. Write and maintain high-quality code, participate in code reviews, and assist in the development of the team's best practices. Assume your share of responsibility for the team and project, demonstrating a vision and drive that goes beyond mere coding.
Qualifications  At least 4 years of hands-on experience working with data technologies and software development, with proficiency in AWS or Azure, Python (software development), ETL, and SQL. Appreciation for experience with technologies such as Spark, DataBricks, Snowflake, and real-time data integrations. A strong desire and capacity to learn new data and software development technologies and methodologies. Excellent collaboration skills, characterised by knowledge sharing, peer support, and a willingness to seek help when needed. Effective communication skills and fluency in Finnish (required) and English.
Benefits  Competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. Exciting opportunities to work on innovative projects. Continuous learning and professional development. A supportive and collaborative team environment. Access to cutting-edge data and software development technologies.

job_description:
About the job
            
 
We are looking for you if, you have: Hands-on experience building complex data pipelines,Knowledge of data manipulation and transformation,Experience with Apache Airflow, Spark, Python,Experience in setting up and optimizing both SQL and noSQL data stores, as well as familiarity with object storage services (e.g., S3). Knowledge of software engineering best practices,Deployment and provisioning automation tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD).
You'll get extra points for: Experience working in cloud environment (e.g., Azure DevOps, GCP),Knowledge of MLOps architecture and practices,Experience managing and further developing distributed systems and clusters for batch processing. Familiarity with data streaming frameworks (Kafka/Flink),Familiarity with monitoring and observability (ELK stack),Agile way of working,Comfortable working in the international and cross-functional teams.
Your responsibilities: Design, build, and maintain our big data infrastructureDevelop data processing scripts using PySparkIntegrate various data sources, ensuring data integrity and consistency.Develop and implement data architectures, data models, and data ingestion pipelines.Troubleshoot data issues, providing robust solutions to ensure optimal performance and reliability.Continuously optimize our systems for performance and cost-effectiveness.Document technical specifications, procedures, and outcomes.Use Azure DevOps for CI/CD, task tracking, version control, and other DevOps practices.Evidence IT risk related to data assets.Improve data products based on customer feedback.
Information about the team:You will work as a data engineer in our core Analytics squad – One Client Core (OCC) within the ING Analytics Wholesale Bank Global Tribe. The squad provides curated data on Wholesale banking (WB) clients via various channels that include API, dashboards, and databases. Target audience is everyone in WB who wants to use data to build products, automated services, dashboards, reports, and models. You will be part of the squad consisting of the data analysts, engineers, and product manager.

location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain (Hybrid)
job_description:
About the job
            
 
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team and help us build and maintain scalable data pipelines and systems. You will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and deploying data solutions that meet the needs of our clients and stakeholders. You will also collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and other data engineers to ensure data quality, reliability, and performance.If you are interested in working on petabytes of data from millions of devices. If solving complex data issues excites you this is the opportunity for you.Responsibilities Leads the team to write, deploy, and maintain software to build, integrate, manage, maintain, and quality-assure data.Architects, designs, implements, and maintains reliable and scalable data solutions in the AWS cloud environment using Scrum/Agile methodology.Implement data ingestion, transformation, and processing workflows using ETL tools and frameworks.Researches and promotes new tools and techniques to shape the future of the data engineering environment.Ensure data security, privacy, and compliance with relevant regulations and policies.Monitor, troubleshoot, and debug data issues and performance bottlenecks. Guides team to deploy secure and well-tested software that meets privacy and compliance requirements; develops, maintains, and improves CI / CD pipeline.Document and communicate data engineering processes and solutions to stakeholders and users.Represents the data engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.Works with following site-reliability engineering standard methodologies: on-call rotations for services they maintain, responsible for defining and maintaining SLAs. Design, build, deploy and maintain infrastructure as code. Containerizes server deployments.Actively contributes to improve developer velocity.
Knowledge & Skills Demonstrable coding expertise in one or more object-oriented programming languages (e.g., Python, Scala, Java, etc.)Deep and hands-on experience (5+ years) designing, planning, productionizing, maintaining, and documenting reliable and scalable data infrastructure and data products in complex environments.Hands on experience with: Expert in AWS tools and services such as S3, Glue, Lambda, EMR, Redshift, Athena, etc.Experience with other cloud platforms and services such as Azure, GCP, etc. is a plus.Experience with data quality, testing, and validation tools and techniquesExperience with data visualization and reporting tools such as QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI, etc.Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent communication and collaboration skill 
Understanding Data Structures & Algorithms & their performanceExperience designing and implementing large-scale distributed systems.Deep knowledge and hands-on experience in technologies across all data lifecycle stagesInternal client management and ability to lead large organizations via influence .Ability to effectively communicate product architectures, design proposals and negotiate options at senior management levels.
Education & Experience Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent.
About HPYou’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

job_title: Senior Data Engineer (f/m/d) Azure Cloud - Expert Services
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Job DescriptionDo you love data and technology? Do you think we all need to become more sustainable? Are you ready to drive and boost the green energy transition? Then this is the right job for you. Your energy shapes the future!Being aware of the enormous responsibility we have for our customers, our assets, and the environment, we are analyzing and developing solutions, utilizing advanced big data and machine learning technologies to provide the best service, improve the efficiency and make things smarter, better, and cleaner.What You Are Responsible For Develop and execute a comprehensive data architecture and machine learning operations (MLOps) ssolutions aligned with the organization's goals and objectives. Serve as primary point of contact for the leadership team and mentor other team members to learn new skillsSupport individual projects and initiatives at the initial stage when being set-up working with the team on a fitting architecture. Take ownership of the technical evaluations of new candidates in the hiring processStay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies related to data architecture and engineering. Evaluate and recommend new tools, technologies, and methodologies to enhance data management and analysis capabilities. 
What You Are Good At You have 3+ years of professional experience in a leading data architecture or engineering role. You have a degree/PhD in Computer Science or a related technical discipline or other significant work experience and you love mathematics and statistics. You have extensive knowledge of Azure, AWS and GCP cloud environments, architecture best practices and tools relevant for machine learning / AI use casesYou have extensive knowledge and hands-on experience of Infrastructure-as-Code frameworks, such as Terraform and/or ARM templates. You have proven experience in ETL processes, data extraction, transformation, and loading. Familiarity with Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and Azure Synapse Analytics are a plus. You have extensive knowledge and hands-on experience of DevOps, CI/CD pipelines and deployment best practices. You have knowledge of Machine Learning frameworks like scikit-learn, Tensor Flow, PyTorch, Azure ML, etc. (including ML interpretability). You have excellent programming skills in Python, SQL,You enjoy collaborating internationally and across cultural borders. You have excellent communication and presentation skills. You are fluent in English and German. You have extensive knowledge in the energy industry (considered as plus)
What you can expect from a Career in E.ON Digital Technology We offer the unique opportunity to combine your love for technology with your passion to work on a topic of high relevance for society. You will be able to contribute to E.ONs ambitious digitalization strategy, to apply and broaden your expertise on a variety of assignments, to work with cutting edge technology and to have the opportunity to grow your career internationally across the wider organization.InclusionIt is important to us that people with disabilities have access to a fair application process, providing them with an opportunity to shine. Therefore, our representative body for severely disabled people will be included in the process from an early stage. Please let us know via the application form if you require technical or organisational adjustments during the application process. We will strive to make the required aids available.Should you not be able to apply online and want to speak someone in person, please contact your local recruiter.

job_description:
About the job
            
 
Data EngineerLocation: Berlin. Hybrid, on-sitePermanent contract.Our client is a dynamic and innovative startup committed to revolutionizing data management for wholesalers. They work on a solution that seamlessly integrates with leading platforms like SAP, transforming data into actionable insights.We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer to join their growing team. As a Data Engineer you will play a pivotal role in prototyping and owning the data warehouse for wholesalers, enabling them to unlock the full potential of their data.Tech stack spans: Databricks, AWS, Python, Spark, pySpark, Spark Streaming, Delta TablesResponsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain a robust data warehouse, connecting diverse data sources, including SAP, and transforming them into a cohesive data lake.Implement and optimize data pipelines, ensuring efficient and reliable data processing and storage.Conduct thorough data analysis to extract meaningful insights that contribute to the enhancement of the data warehouse.Take ownership of the end-to-end data engineering process, from data collection to analysis and reporting.
Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.Proven experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on designing and implementing data warehouses.Proficient in working with data integration tools and technologiesStrong programming skills in Python (data stack and OOP)Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and data optimization techniques.Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced startup environment.
Benefits: Joining a dynamic and innovative startup with a vibrant and collaborative culture.Opportunity for professional growth and development.Competitive salary and benefits package.Flexible work environment (hybrid working model)

About the job
            
 
Join us as a Data Engineer and take part in the development and maintenance of data flows serving Data Analytics and AI related international projects.Your responsibilities will include  Design, implementation, test and optimization of reliable, efficient, high quality data pipelinesAutomate the extraction, loading and transformation of data from a wide variety of sourcesProviding solutions to acquire data from these source systems in an automated wayEnsuring compliance to data related security guidelinesAnalysis of data flows and processes to identify possibilities for improvementActive cooperation and communication with various project teams distributed across EuropeDiscovery of data provisioning capabilities of various source systems that are based on a wide range of technologies
You are looking for us, if you have  A proven track record in building data sets and pipelines for analytical use casesFluent knowledge in Python, however other languages may be an advantage (including JavaScript, Scala and Java)Expert-level knowledge in building and optimizing data lakes, distributed datasets and data pipelines, especially in Apache SparkKnowledge of Azure data ecosystem (Databricks, Data Factory)Knowledge of different data formats (JSON, XML, Parquet, CSV)Great analytical skills and architectural know-how to select the right tool for the right use caseExcellent technical understanding of how to meet non-functional requirements including query performance, data quality and securityExperience working with relational databases and have advanced SQL knowledgeExperience working as DevOps EngineerFluent English knowledge
You will be successful if you  Have experience in working with the technology stack described aboveHave strong analytic skills and can cope with unstructured or incomplete data and informationLike working on projects with high responsibilityHave a solution-focused approachCan work autonomously and can fill information gaps in cooperation with project stakeholders
 What are the benefits of joining us as an employee? Even when you work hard, you will still have time for your personal life: our flexible working hours based on core time, the exact observance of the designated number of working hours, the occasional option of working from home, and the benefits that can be extended to cover your family you can also improve your non-working life!We have long-term plans for you! We have carefully designed career paths (and a career management system), we provide the appropriate training courses and projects to accomplish your aims.Our community is characterized by mutual respect and an attitude of helpfulness. This high professional quality level and the colorful personalities will help you spend your everyday life in a good mood, why you make the best of your skills and talents.We are happy when you are open and help you discover the world: after six months you will receive substantial discounts that you can use to visit any place in the world taking Lufthansa flights!In addition to an inclusive and helpful atmosphere, trust is also an important value for us. You can rely on us with anything right from your first day, and we also trust you to the utmost extent.

About the job
            
 
OverviewAs a Data Engineer, you will provide solutions on the data processing, engineering, and enrichment phase for various projects. You will be responsible for some aspects of the data life cycle including design, maintenance and building of cloud and data architectures. These activities will deliver on ingestion, transformation, and building of high-quality data structures.You will be responsible for: Creating, monitoring, and troubleshooting ELT jobs to ingest and transform data from various systems using batch and stream processing;Driving and advocating for state-of-the-art methods of handling data in the company, eg. data lake, stream processing, IaC, DevOps, DataOpsCollaborate with analytics and business teams to improve data feed.
As a DE, the majority of your work will involve performing new data ingestions from various sources such as databases, APIs, and files. This will require your skills in extracting, loading, and transforming data into a usable format for downstream analysis.The remaining of your work will involve supporting the maintenance of existing ETL jobs. This will require your attention to detail and strong problem-solving skills in monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving any issues that arise.Your role will be critical in ensuring the successful ingestion and processing of new data, while maintaining the integrity and efficiency of existing ETL jobs.You will be working with the following technologies: Python, Prefect (preferred), Dask, SQLKafka (preferred)AWS and/or AzureDockerLinux, bash, gitCI/CD
What will you need to be successful in the role? Demonstrated proficiency in the data engineering areaIntermediate PythonStrong SQLUnderstanding of cloud solutionsUnderstanding of DockerFamiliarity with LinuxExperience with ETL
What do we offer? Hybrid workNice office near the center of Krakow (Zabłocie)Lot of mentoring and training. We want you to thrive as a member of our team and for that reason, we will provide you with a lot of opportunities to grow both personally and professionallyRelaxed working environment with lots of support, nurturing and funGood work-life balance. We believe that only happy, well-rested employees can work well and do goodLux Med private HealthcareMultisport CardKrakow transportation card

About the job
            
 
Join the Revolution!Are you an experienced Data Engineer eager to join a dynamic start-up that values culture over everything? At RevoData, we foster a no-ego, no-nonsense culture. We encourage people to push boundaries, think on their feet and challenge each other, at the end of the day, we win as a team. Sounds like you? Then read on!As a Principal Data Engineer, you will lead the development and delivery of data and AI solutions in Databricks that drive business growth and improve customer experiences. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand client needs, identify opportunities and create the roadmap for new solutions and productsThe experience you bring  You have worked on at least 2 projects or data products from ideation to production.Have experience with taking ownership of new ideas and developments.Know how to let others learn from you while empowering them to grow.You show deep curiosity and inquisitiveness about customer needs and elevate the customer experience.You are a constant learner who is passionate about staying at the forefront of the Data & AI landscape through reading journals, books, or blogs. You can easily sum up your top 3 when asked.You dream in Python and SQL.Collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders, actively contributing to various projects - this is why fluency in Dutch is important (if you're not native but have a strong willingness to be proficient, still apply)!The ability to identify business opportunities and craft technical solution options together with architecture and engineeringYou have previously led discovery, elicit user needs, challenges, and opportunities.You have a track record of owning the quality of Data & AI solutions, including technical debt.
What we offer At RevoData, we value our teams' development and well being. To give you a sneak peek into some of the perks you can expect: Ongoing Learning: Access an education budget without limits, collaborating with our partners (such as Databricks, AWS, Microsoft, and ThoughtSpot). Enjoy personalized onboarding and a well-defined career trajectory.Create your best workspace: Select a MacBook or a Windows Laptop, keyboard and other kit to your preferences.Learning Opportunities: Engage in Wednesday Lunch & Learn sessions and team workshopsDaily Nourishment: Relish in delectable daily lunches provided right at the office.Community Engagement: Become a part of our Climbing Club, join a cooking workshop or sign up for your charity sky dive.Join our pension plan.Work-Life Balance: We prioritize well-being above all. Hence we favor a well-being budget, internet coverage, and an allowance for remote work, over things such as a bonus on billable hours.
Our Approach:At RevoData, transparency is crucial. We value getting to know you better, and our final interview takes place in person at our Amsterdam office.Please note, we do not cover interview travel costs or relocation expenses and cannot provide visa sponsorships as we are a start-up.Ready to Join Us?If you resonate with our technology, culture, and vision, we're excited to meet you! Apply directly through this vacancy, our website, or connect with Leah Cullen on LinkedIn. We appreciate a CV that goes further than listing your job experience. Perhaps even accompany it with your favourite Spotify playlist, a picture of your dog, your favourite bouldering gym or the best book you have ever read.Important Dates:We've been rapidly growing, we hired 5 new team members in September alone. Yet a strong RevoData fit is everything to us. We see you as an asset to our team and never turn recruitment into a numbers game. Multiple start dates available from January to March 2024. When as a collective we hit our 2024 goals, you can join us at the Data & AI Summit in San Francisco in 2025!Join RevoData, where you can make a meaningful impact and be part of an inspiring journey. Let's revolutionise data together!As we are a start-up we are not registered with the IND in the Netherlands as a referee employer and cannot provide sponsorship.

About the job
            
 
We are looking for a Senior Data Infrastructure Engineer (all genders) to join our Data & Analytics department at flaconi. You will be part of our Data Engineering team of eight people and manage flaconi’s cloud data infrastructure to ensure the smooth operation of our data pipelines. What can you expect in this role? Innovative projects in an all cloud environment and API building, and an attractive business set-up from e-commerce, involving many (also unstructured) data sources and use-cases.Your role You collaborate with the team members to optimize data pipelines and workflows, ensuring efficient and reliable data processingBesides, you are responsible for designing, deploying and managing the AWS cloud infrastructure using Terraform, focusing on EC2 instances, networking, security groups, and other related services like S3 or LambdaYou take an active part in the transformation towards Lakehouse on Databricks by managing and administering the platform and enable the Data Engineers to develop efficiently by managing and developing the CI/CD pipelines furtherYou monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and scalability of data infrastructureYou document processes, procedures, and configurations to ensure knowledge sharing and maintain system documentationFurthermore, you follow the ‘You build it, you run it’ mindset: You participate in the full development process, from design, through implementation and testing, to code reviews and deployment
Your profile Proven experience in managing and maintaining cloud infrastructure, preferably using TerraformStrong understanding of cloud computing platforms and related servicesFamiliarity with Databricks platform for Data Engineering is a strong plusProficiency in Python programming and experience with data processing frameworks - Spark is a plusSolid knowledge of SQL and experience with relational databasesHands-on experience with workflow orchestration tools like Airflow and experience with Pentaho Data Integration (PDI) or similar ETL tools is a plusGood written and verbal English
What we offer you Full transparency: For this role, we have a salary band between 75000€ and 95000€ gross per year. The salary that we will offer you will always be within this span and is based on the skills that you show during the recruitment process.Our employees matter to us: We offer you a permanent contract and will cover the costs for your BVG or Deutschland ticket.Work-life balance: 29 vacation days, flexible working hours, up to three days of working from home a week and in specific cases the option to work 100 % remotely; the possibility of a paid sabbatical.flaconi Academy: Actively shape your own career path by taking advantage of our internal and external training opportunities.We care about your well being: We want to support you also during difficult times. For this, we offer you and your close relatives counseling sessions with mental health professionals.flaconi Fitness: a wide range of sports options & discounts on memberships.Family first: Our “emergency-daycare” is there for you in out-of-the-ordinary situations to look after your child on site at our office.Thinking about tomorrow together: flaconi subsidizes your savings contribution to the company pension scheme with an additional 20%.A comfortable working space with everything you need: High end technical equipment, fruits and drinks, no dress code and dogs are welcome in our office!Other perks: Great discounts in our online shop as well with our partner companies, cool team events & company parties!
About flaconiWith more than three million active customers, flaconi is one of Germany’s leading online beauty retailers. The online shop’s extensive portfolio consists of almost 1000 national and international brands and 50.000 products. From drugstore over organic cosmetics to premium and luxury, the online shop covers all product segments and offers a diverse selection of products for a unique and daily self-care routine.Founded in 2011 as one of the first online perfumeries, flaconi is honored to work with more than 700 people from 60 different nations at the flaconi headquarters in Berlin-Charlottenburg and its fulfillment center in Halle.With the Flaconi Concept Store in the historic Tuteur House in Berlin, flaconi is also represented in the stationary trade and offers its customers an exquisite range of niche and premium brands as well as an integrated hair salon.flaconi has received numerous awards and is also represented in Austria, Poland and France.Shape our company’s success with us and apply now online! We look forward to receiving your complete application documents including your earliest starting date. Please direct your application to Pia Niemuth (Talent Acquisition).

We are an established, globally active management consulting company with offices in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, UK, USA, Singapore, Hong Kong, the Philippines, Australia, Indonesia and India. We are a valued partner to many of the world‘s largest international financial services and insurance firms. We support our clients at all project management stages from the development of strategies and operational frameworks to the technical implementation and handover. About the job
            
 
Mediahuis is looking for ...a Data Engineer to strengthen the Data Team within Technology & Product Studio (TPS). And we believe you are the right person …Because we need, a specialist with a can-do mentality and a passion for data. Someone who takes ownership of the various parts of the platform at an operational level, but with an eye for the broader picture.You’ve started daydreaming upon this? Then please read on carefully, because it only gets better! Here's a summary of what the job entails: In addition to the development of the Data & Analytics Platform, you are energized by servicing the product teams within Mediahuis with the necessary tools. Together with your team, you are also responsible for numerous updates and optimizations. As an expert within the Data domain, you are enthusiastic to share your experience and expertise within and outside the team.To provide a clear insight into the team's responsibilities, we would like to divide them into 5 parts: Maintenance: As a team, we ensure that the Data & Analytics platform is and remains up and running. This involves real-time monitoring, updating, and documenting;Infrastructure: As a team, we focus on the long-term data infrastructure/architecture on the one hand, but on the other hand we are also busy optimizing cloud consumption, setting up new components, and expanding the functionalities of existing components;Data Processing & Management: We do not work from an ivory tower, but are involved in the business. We ensure that data is available, that new flows fit within the larger data infrastructure and we provide daily support to data scientists, analysts, and data platform users;Projects: As a data engineering team, we play a key role in the realization of groundbreaking AI projects. Setting up pipelines to bring data from A to B with minimal delay is one of the challenges we regularly face. In addition, we also build APIs for the integration of our products into user applications or introduce innovative and ground-breaking solutions in our architecture to enable specific use cases;Knowledge sharing: All this is only possible thanks to an excellent exchange of knowledge and experience.
What's about to become your second home? You will join the Data Engineering Team. This team develops infrastructure that makes it easy to collect and process large amounts of data so that the entire Mediahuis group can use action-oriented insights.What’s on your CV,is important, but by no means the only thing we find important. You are a proactive person who takes ownership of his or her platforms and projects. You ensure that all systems work as expected and you get energy from picking up and sharing knowledge with the rest of the organization.As an expert within Data you have a solid knowledge of Python and Pandas. The most important thing is that you are interested in distributed systems and you want to dig into technologies like Dask. In addition, you are familiar with the Azure or Google Cloud environment and it is recommended that you have experience with various open source tools such as Airflow, Jupyter and Kubernetes.You have an agile mindset and are a real team player. Knowledge of English is a must, knowledge of Dutch is a forte. You are available on short notice.What do you get in return?Just as we believe in the uniqueness of all our brands, we also believe in the uniqueness and personality of all our people. At Mediahuis it is not merely about your job, but also about your growth and career opportunities. In addition to the basics (a good salary, fringe benefits, etc.) we mainly focus on a pleasant work environment, flexible work arrangements (teleworking, flexible hours) and continuous training opportunities. Mediahuis is more than an employer, just as you are more than the words on your CV. Further information about our assets can be found here. You can get an idea of our company culture and atmosphere on various social media channels.As a data engineer, you’ll get the opportunity to leave your mark on the Mediahuis data landscape, and to take the organization to a higher level of data maturity. Furthermore, you will contribute to the AI applications that will help determine the future of Mediahuis. It’s avaried job with the freedom to unleash your creativity, surrounded by a great team of experts who are eager to share their knowledge with you. It’s up to you now!Will you take your chance or continue to daydream? If the position of Data Engineer fits you like a glove, please don’t hesitate to apply via the button below. Getting acquainted can’t hurt. You don’t fully match this profile, but are motivated to take the next step in your career? Come talk to us!

WHY ADATIS? There’s a long list of reasons, from the profit-share bonus to the company away days. We take your career development very seriously, and we have a clear career model, a mentor programme that works and a culture where sharing information and insight is part of everyday.  Attractive salary and Profit Share BonusGreat holiday allowance - 25 days + public holidaysCompany team days (3 times a year!!)Unlimited budget for books for your learningTrips to technical conferences (e.g. SQLBits)Travel cardMultisport card All the usual perks (pension, healthcare blah blah) A company that values its' team above all elseFreedom to grow your career pathA flat hierarchy and no-door policyA relaxed approach to where you work (office, home, client)
 INTERESTED?We are keen to talk to people who want to work in a people-first business, and, like all of us, be keen to support, mentor and innovate together. This is a business small enough to know everyone; but big enough to provide great career opportunities. And we’re not precious about the way we do things; if there are better ways to do something, we want you to tell us and then make it happen.  At Adatis, we believe, inclusion is the bridge for everyone to be their authentic self. We respect and celebrate our differences as diversity is what makes us unique and sparks our innovation. About the job
            
 
Disclaimer: Herken je je in deze vacature, of wil je in deze richting groeien? Onze data community heeft plaats voor jou!Data staan centraal in de digitale transformaties die onze klanten doormaken. Je belandt bij AE in een informele bedrijfscultuur waar een gezellig pintje én een sterke kenniswerking rond data hand in hand gaan. Wil je uitgedaagd worden door en bijleren van straffe collega’s binnen onze data community? Top. Wil je ook jouw eigen expertise delen? Nog beter.Als data engineer help je onze klanten met het realiseren van hun projecten. Je vertrekt daarbij vanuit je sterke conceptuele en technische skills. Je weet of een klant meer geholpen is met batch- of streamingoplossingen en hoe zich dat dan concreet vertaalt in een kappa- of lambda-architectuur. Je bent benieuwd om data mesh principes te implementeren in de praktijk.Voor jou kennen de vier stappen van ons data framework geen verrassingen:1. Het verkrijgen van data.Jij weet hoe je de data op de beste en meest efficiënte manier uit een systeem kan halen en deze dan kan doorsluizen naar een ander systeem. Je kent daarbij batch- en streamingoplossingen. Change data capture heeft voor jouw geen geheimen meer. Je wordt spontaan kwaad als de datakwaliteit in de bron niet goed zit.2. Het verwerken van data. Je weet welke tools het beste geschikt zijn om data te verwerken en te transformeren. Je weet dat er andere tools zijn voor verwerkingen in batch en in streaming. Je onderzoekt graag of performantie-issues te wijten zijn aan je algoritme of aan die verdomde Data Scientists die alle resources opsouperen.3. Het opslaan van data. Voor ieder project weet je het juiste type data-opslag te identificeren. Je kent de toepassingen van graph-databases en documentstores. Je weet hoe de juiste datastore het verschil kan maken voor de snelheid van toepassingen.4. Het publiceren van data. Je kan data gestructureerd aanbieden, zodat de meest overzichtelijke rapporten en fancy dashboards erop gebouwd kunnen worden. Jij kan een API bouwen bovenop een dataproduct. En als er iemand anders een ander gek idee heeft om data te gaan gebruiken in een toepassing, wil je daar graag aan meewerken.AE is op zoek naar mensen die met hun technologische kennis mee het verschil kunnen én willen maken. Dat kan specifiek vanuit een bepaalde expertise zijn, bijvoorbeeld in AWS of Azure, of eerder als generalist. Als generalist weet je welke tools je wanneer moet inzetten. Je weet dat je met Flink en Kafka streaming oplossingen kan bouwen, maar dat je voor batch eerder naar Spark en Airflow moet kijken. Je weet ook dat dbt en Snowflake natuurlijke partners zijn om een datawarehouse te maken en dat je dankzij Docker en Kubernetes je toepassingen overal kan laten draaien.Heb je een voorliefde voor Azure? Dan weet je hoe je ons data framework moet vertalen naar componenten zoals Data Factory, Databricks en PowerBI. Je weet wanneer je moet kiezen voor Azure Data Lake Storage en wanneer Synapse een betere keuze is.Is AWS je ding? Dan haal je Kinesis, Glue en Lambda boven, als er data verkregen moet worden. Je kan data opslaan in S3 of Redshift en je weet dat Athena gebruikt kan worden om data te verkennen.In welke omgeving je ook wil werken: je kent Python. Indien nodig kan je ook overweg met Java, .NET of scala (of snel aanleren).
Waarin maakt AE voor jou het verschil?  De projecten van AE zijn end-to-end digitale transformatieprojecten, waarbij jouw rol focust op het data-aspect, maar waarin je omgeven wordt door een multidisciplinair team. Zo zie je steeds het bredere plaatje waarin je werkt!Op regelmatige tijdstippen kan je intappen op de data community met events waar brainfood, kennisuitwisseling en gezelligheid samengaan.AE dropt je niet in een vakje, maar moedigt je aan om je te verbreden binnen je eigen interesses.We voorzien een lange termijn coach, die samen met jou richting geeft aan jouw groei en loopbaan en een engagement manager die je ondersteunt bij je dagdagelijkse taken op het project. Je kan deze coaching rollen ook zelf opnemen naar collega’s toe.Je komt terecht bij een stabiele speler mét een start-up vibe. Je drukt je stempel op onze data community of engageert je voor één van onze zotte ideetjes zoals de AE hackathon of de Techscape.Je uitvalsbasis is ons hoofdkantoor in Leuven of één van onze vestigingen in Gent (Ghelamco), Antwerpen, Groot-Bijgaarden of Hasselt. Je werkt op kantoor of van thuis uit in combinatie met projectwerk bij de klant.

About the job
            
 
A propos de nous :HomeServe conçoit des services pour simplifier les réparations et améliorer la performance énergétique de la maison.Notre promesse Agir durablement sur l'habitat de nos 1.3 millions de clients pour garantir confort, sérénité et sobriété des ressources en eau et en énergie.Pour y parvenir, depuis plus de 20 ans, nous plaçons notre dynamique entrepreneuriale, le développement des compétences et la qualité de vie au travail au coeur de notre aventure.Votre mission si vous nous rejoignez Exprimer votre énergie aux côtés de nos 1200 collaborateurs et partager nos 3 valeurs : être audacieux, engagé et attentionné.Notre division HomeServe Energies Service (HES) est dédiée aux activités chauffage, ventilation, climatisation et rénovation énergétique de la Maison. Elle se développe par croissance externe en faisant l'acquisition d'entreprises sur l'ensemble du territoire français (4 par an en moyenne). Aujourd'hui HES regroupe 17 sociétés et 700 collaborateurs.Intégrer HomeServe, c'est rejoindre: - Une entreprise \"Great Place to Work\"  et \"Best Workplaces 2021 et 2022\"- Un service client certifié « Élu Service Client de l'Année » 7 années consécutives, dans la catégorie Services à l'Habitat- Une entreprise engagée en faveur du développement durable avec son programme RSE Empreinte 2030 qui repose sur 3 piliers stratégiques : l'environnement, les Hommes et la société et le ClientLE POSTE:Nous recrutons un Lead Dev salesforce afin de nous accompagner dans le cadre du développement de notre division HomeServe Energies Services.  Rattaché(e) au Tech Lead de la Team salesforce composée de 5 Lead Dev, vous intervenez depuis la phase de conception jusqu'à la livraison des applications destinées au système d'information et à sa maintenance.Vous participez également aux différentes phases d'architecture en collaboration avec les architectes/Tech Lead/Lead Dev. Vous assurez l'analyse des demandes de développement, la conception technique, le codage, la mise au point et la documentation des programmes, dans le respect des normes et standards en vigueur dans le service.Vous intégrez l'équipe technique d'HomeServe (30 personnes) qui gère les applications métier, les sites web et l'infrastructure (on premise et cloud), avec de nombreux challenges et projets en cours.Vos principales missions :- Analyser/comprendre les besoins du métier en collaboration avec les Product Owner/Business Analyst/développeurs- Apporter l'expertise technique et les solutions aux problématiques de développement, et les estimer- Etre force de proposition sur le choix de la meilleure solution (performance, coût, délai)- Encadrer et animer l'équipe de développeurs "externes"- Prendre en charge des activités de paramétrage et de développement- Gérer les US de dette technique- Appliquer les bonnes pratiques et l'ensemble des outils de développement, d'intégration et de déploiement. Votre profil pour réussir dans ce rôle Vous possédez au moins 5 années d'expérience dans le développement informatique, notamment  dans l'écosystème Salesforce.Vous maitrisez les langages et technologies liés à Salesforce (APEX, LWC, Flow, Experience Cloud, Service Cloud, SFS)Des certifications sont appréciées pour le posteVous avez une expérience en intégration avec des systèmes tiers et/ou connaissance des APIVous avez une bonne connaissance des outils de développement et de déploiement afin d'en garantir les bonnes pratiques (GitLab, CI/CD)Soft Skills :Capacité à travailler en mode agileCapacité d'analyse, organisation et rigueurDe nature curieuse, vous êtes force de proposition pour optimiser l'existant Capacité à gérer l'incertitude et d'avoir une approche "Test & Learn" ;Excellent relationnel et esprit d'équipeForte adaptabilité, autonomieEsprit critique, capacité à prendre de la hauteur, assertivitéParce que chez HomeServe, nous sommes convaincus que la diversité fait la richesse d'une entreprise, nous étudions à compétences égales toutes les candidatures.Ce que HomeServe vous  propose :- Type de contrat : CDI - Prise de poste : dès que possible- Lieu : Lyon 7ème Jean-Macé (desservi bus, métro, tram, train)- Avantages: Participation, intéressement , carte ticket restaurant, transport en commun remboursés à 70%, train à 85% et indemnité kilométrique vélo, chèque CESU...- Rémunération : 50-55 Keuros- Un espace de travail moderne qui favorise le bien-être au travail  (locaux, outils...)- Télétravail nomade possible Ref : 18718057

Working in an agile environment and keeping up with the ever-evolving technical landscape the Senior Data Engineer is a lifelong learner and likes to think outside the box.Please note the closing date for applications is: Sunday 10th DecemberAbout The Job As a Senior Data Engineer, you are a go-to person working as part of a cross-functional team that enables data engineering skills and capabilities across the FirstChoice platform and websites. Being an enthusiast in data engineering, with an advanced DevSecOps mindset, you’ll use your excellent collaboration skills to work with your team to deliver the best answers to our customers’ needs with full responsibility for its data flows, from design to operation.
