About the job
            
 
Brief info about VintedVinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.Information about the positionVinted’s Data Platform team is looking for talent! A team who is building the platform to serve thousands of queries, handle PetaBytes of data, and serve over 1,800 customers is looking for a new member to join on the journey in building the state-of-the-art data platform. You will be joining the Data Infra domain where we are building products to enable our Data Capabilities across the Group. As a member of the On-Premises team you will be working closely with the team and other engineering teams to scale our existing platform and improve the customers’ experience. On a daily basis you will be faced with challenges that a 100 node cluster with 6PB of storage and 50TB of RAM will bring. And indeed we sometimes run out of RAM! Join us in an environment where complexity is not foreign and where bold moves are embraced!Come join us in an organization which is hyper-focused on supporting and developing best-in-class engineering talent, as well as creating an inclusive team environment for people to do their best work.Take a look at www.vinted.engineering/ to get a sense of our challenges and read some reflections of Vinted’s culture on https://www.vinted.lt/jobs.In this position, you’ll Solve technical problems that have large scope, complexity, and business impactRecognize impediments to our efficiency as a team, propose and implement solutionsAdvocate for improvements to product, performance, and security
About You 3+ years of professional software development experienceKnowledge of agile, DevOps & Automation - testing, build, deployment, CI/CD, etc. Experience with modern software development life-cycleWorking proficiency and communication skills in written and verbal EnglishSelf-motivated and self-managing, with excellent organizational skillsExperience working with Docker, and KubernetesExperience with programming in Scala, Java, Python, Ruby or similarExperience working on building data platformsSystematic problem-solving approach, coupled with effective communication skillsInterest and ability to learn new software development skills and techniquesExperience with distributed computing frameworks like Apache SparkExperience with Hadoop ecosystem components, such as Hive and CDP. Not all listed technologies are required, so don’t hesitate to apply if you’re only familiar with a part of them or have worked with alternative technologies. We are interested in hearing about the value you can bring to the role, even if you don’t fulfil all the expectations. 
Work perks The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 working days of holidayM1 MacBooksMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniturePrivate health insuranceA daily lunch allowanceFrequent team-building eventsA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly office
Working at VintedIndividual Learning BudgetVinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.Hybrid WorkWe’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.Equal OpportunityThe Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.The salary range for this position is € 4,950 - € 6,700 gross per month.

About the job
            
 
Data Quality and Analytics team is looking for a data-loving person who could help us accelerate providing insights and clarity to all Infare's departments. The team is responsible for facilitating both real time and batch data needed for business decisions and indicate areas of improvement. In Infare we collect 3 billion flight ticket records and our team process 300 million analytical rows on daily basis. Our team consists of Data Engineers and a Data Analyst. We are preparing to move our Data Analytics pipeline to AWS cloud and we're looking for a Data Engineer who could help us to make this transition. As a Data Engineer, you will work closely with all departments to understand their complex systems and create efficient data pipelines. The systems vary from a simple CRM integration to complex real time data collection metrics. You will also participate in data management activities such as analyzing complex data elements, data flows, dependencies, and relationships to build consistent business intelligence solutions.Areas of responsibility:  Participate in cloud migration project of existing analytical solutions Development of efficient and scalable data pipelines to ingest and expose business data Collaborate with Data Analysts to build data and analytics solutions Work on data modeling and database design to ensure that systems are able to cope with vast amounts of data 
Your experience: Implementation of Data Warehouse / Data Lake solutions Successful integration of cost-effective data pipelines with multiple data sources, data destinations would be an advantage Experience in configuring scheduled jobs orchestration Identifying, designing and implementing improvements to internal business processes allowing to optimize data delivery, automate manual processes 
Skills:  Worked deeply with any relational database system (MSSQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL) AWS/Azure/GCP data processing productsIt would be great if you worked with at least one of Databricks, Snowflake, NoSQL databases Python 
Nice to have:  Azure DevOps, DataDog IaaC with Terraform Airflow PowerBI
What we offer in the Vilnius office: People-centric & flexible companyFree lunches, breakfast, and snacks at the office every dayHealth insurance5 extra days of holidaysPossibility to participate in the 3rd level pension fund after 6 months in the companyA parking space at the officeLots of fun, a gaming zone with a console, VR, table tennis, foosball, and all that jazzSalary from 4959 gross
Interview flow you may expect: HR screening interview with two HR’s, Jurgita and GiedreInterview with Simonas Stonys, Team Lead of Data Analytics, and Giedre, Head of PeopleTechnical interview with Jesper Frimodt, Software Delivery Manager & Technology Advisor and Simonas Stonys, Team Lead of Data AnalyticsMeeting with Data Quality and Analytics Team members in the office
Why this role?At Infare, we build products that open doors to the right decisions by the air travel industry. Since 2000, we have gathered, and we keep collecting a massive amount of data and insights that allow airlines to understand and to react to competitor behavior.As air travel is becoming an increasingly large and competitive industry, fare intelligence is of vital importance. For this reason, our tools and products have become of major interest to airlines and airports in the past years: in fact, we have 19 of 20 world’s largest airlines as our customers on top of 200+ other carriers, and our business has been growing for years.Data is at the core of our business, as we use it for our final products such as Pharos, Altus, and others. However, we need to gather the data from APIs and/or extract it from airline websites, meta-search, and online travel agent sites. This is where our 30+ data collection team is crucial. Its members write, optimize, maintain, and improve 1000+ of our robots/crawlers, and overcome challenges such as volume, quality, dynamism and even blocking on a daily basis. While we seek quality, integrity, and consistency in the data we deliver to our customers, the funniest part about data extraction is that there’s no single rule or method to collect it: the solution is custom every time and it’s our engineers who have total liberty to come up with it!

About the job
            
 
Your tasksYou will have the opportunity to work with your colleagues to design and develop reports for various ALDI Nord business units. The development of the reports will be in close interaction with business stakeholders and source system experts in a dynamic framework. Design and development of data transformation processes (e.g., with Databricks, Spark, or Azure Data Factory)Development and maintenance of software with focus on:Integration of source systemsTransformation of data: Design and development of data modelsQuality and completeness of data: Conception and development of data quality checks and optimizationsTesting of data software developmentTechnical monitoring of componentsPerforming regular deployments as part of the software delivery processDocumentation of data models and processing routes for internal purposes, service providers and usersCoordination with responsible system owners of connected data sources as well as IT and other stakeholdersClose collaboration with Business Intelligence Engineers in the creation of reports, in the form of joint requirements, concepts and work packagesDesign of software features across a whole product lifecycleCoordination with business departments as well as IT and other stakeholders
Requirements Bachelor or Masters Degree in (business) informatics, mathematics or similar fields and 5+ years of relevant job experienceExperienced in Azure services & infrastructure, SQL, Phyton, Apache Spark und GITExperience with the development and operation of cloud technologies (Microsoft Azure, GCP, AWS).Experience with modeling data (Star Schema, Data Vault, Third Normal Form ) and implementation in software products.English: minimum B2/C1
What we offer High degree of creative freedom with the possibility of personal developmentFlexible working time within a hybrid working model - 2 days a week from Cracow officeCompetitive salary according to your competenciesHealth services of Medicover Group, such as private medical care and free access to sport facilitiesCo-financed language coursesModern and well equipped workplace in the attractive Brain Park office complex near the old town of KrakówInspiring and open-minded working atmosphere with “come as you are” cultureSecure job in an international working environment
Please submit your application documents in English, as we will work together a lot in English.About the companyThe ALDI Tech Hub is part of the ALDI Nord Group of Companies – one of the leading international retail enterprises with 5,600 stores and 86, 000 employees in 9 countries. With a tradition stretching back over 100 years, ALDI stands for the invention of discount retailing. Our mission is to provide people everywhere and at all times with what they need for their daily lives: high-quality products at the lowest possible price – simply and swiftly. This also includes making shopping as easy as possible. We ensure this not only in our stores, but just as much behind the scenes: In addition to powerful IT infrastructures for our stores, warehouses and offices, we are working on innovative technologies that will make shopping even easier in the future. The ALDI Tech Hub is an important part of fulfilling this mission.

You will work closely with other developers, product managers, and stakeholders to ensure that the company's software meets the needs of their customers.✅ Responsibilities: Develop and maintain high-quality software applications using PythonDesign and implement scalable and robust solutionsParticipate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to other developersStay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in software development

job_title: Data Analytics Engineer - Aix en Provence
job_description:
About the job
            
 
“At Gojob, we staff Workers instantly, at scale and with care.”Notre mission? Gojob est une plateforme HR Tech qui s’appuie sur ses technologies & données pour fiabiliser, accélérer et humaniser le recrutement et l’accompagnement des Travailleurs Essentiels.Notre succès est concret: +210% de croissance du CA en 3 ans et une expansion impressionnante en France et aux Etats-Unis. Nos équipes, composées de 200 collaborateurs dont 60% de femmes, sont le moteur de ce succès.Nous avons créé une véritable “Communauté Gojob” de plus de 1 000 000 d’utilisateurs qualifiés et disponibles, et nous avons mis à l’emploi plus de 50 000 personnes. C'est ça, l'effet Gojob !Nous sommes fiers de notre plateforme Tech & Data 100% intégrée et propriétaire. Créé en 2017 et supporté par 15M€+ d’investissements, le “Gojob AI Lab” compte plus de 30 développeurs et chercheurs. Ce laboratoire est en charge du développement continu d’Aglaé Matcher (algorithme de matching breveté) et Aglaé Alpha, la nouvelle génération d'IA alimentée par plus de 100 paramètres et 1 milliard de points de données utilisateurs.Notre engagement ne se limite pas à trouver un travail à nos utilisateurs. Nous leur offrons des services financiers exclusifs (“Gojob MonCash”) et nous les aidons à progresser (“Gojob Academy”). Parce que chez Gojob, chaque individu mérite de se réaliser pleinement.La performance économique? Chez Gojob, c'est aussi une affaire d'impact social. Nous avons les labels B Corp et Entreprise Sociale et Solidaire (ESS), et nous recrutons chaque jour plus de 30% de profils éloignés de l’emploi.Présentation du poste :La data est au cœur de la stratégie de Gojob. Notre équipe travaille quotidiennement sur du delivery avec un impact immédiat sur l’offre de service Gojob. Nous renforçons l’équipe Data avec un poste de Analytics Engineer en CDI sur Aix-en-Provence.L'équipe Data est actuellement composée de 8 personnes (1 Head of Data, 2 Analytics Engineer, 1 product Data Analyst, 1 Data Engineer, 3 Data Scientists) et intervient de façon transverse au sein de l'équipe Tech de 50 personnes.L’Analytics occupe une place centrale chez Gojob en remplissant 4 missions principales:- Enrichir notre Data WareHouse (collecte, modélisation dbt)- Construire de bout en bout les meilleurs indicateurs d’aide à la décision pour les biz, produit et tech- Développer des outils data-driven améliorant l’efficacité opérationnelle- Contribuer à mettre en place la culture data-driven et self-serviceDétail des missions :L'Analytics Engineer est à l’écoute des sujets au sein d’une équipe orientée impact pour créer, industrialiser et maintenir des outils de data analyse afin d’aider à la décision et d'améliorer l’efficacité opérationnelle.Il ou elle cadre les besoins directement avec les équipes business et identifie les solutions techniques nécessaires.On attend de lui (ou elle) qu'il construise et maintienne les connecteurs et modèles de données. Il enrichit le data warehouse de Gojob et industrialise les proofs of concept. Il épaule les Data Analysts et Business Analysts à la construction de leurs pipeline de données et de leurs data visualisations.Véritable moteur pour l’équipe, il intervient sur des projets variés :- des projets d’analyse end-to-end- des développements quick wins en agile- du maintien opérationnel pour superviser le monitoring et l’alerting des pipeline- de l’enrichissement de nos DataMart (collecte, préparation de nouvelles tables, test et documentation)- de la veille technologique et de l’amélioration en continue sur la stack data- du coaching technique pour les Data Analysts & membres plus juniors de l’équipeVous vous épanouirez sur ce poste chez nous si vous partagez les 3 piliers de la culture data Gojob :- Valeur ajoutée : ce que nous construisons doit avoir de l’impact business et aider nos équipes à prendre des décisions. Nous faisons preuve de pragmatisme et évitons l’over-engineering- Qualité du développement: nous construisons des outils scalables (suivant les bonnes pratiques de code, industrialisés et debugables) et fiables (maîtrise à 100% des chiffres affichés)- Esprit d’équipe : curiosité et envie d’apporter à l’équipe dans un esprit collaboratifQuelle est notre stack technique ?Code base: Python, SQLGoogle Cloud Platform (GCS, Big Query, Pub Sub, etc.)DevOps: Gitlab, DockerETL: Airflow, dbt, AirbyteBusiness Intelligence: DOMO; Looker StudioCe que nous vous offrons : - Une rémunération attractive selon votre profil - Une politique de télétravail flexible- La carte Swile (équivalent ticket resto) d’une valeur de 9€/jour pris en charge à 55% par Gojob- Une prime Vacances- 6 semaines de Congés Payés- Une excellente mutuelle/prévoyance- 50% du titre de transport en commun remboursé - Un forfait sport/culture/bien-être à 150€/anLes avantages de Gojob:Si vous travaillez sur Aix-en-Provence : 300 jours de soleil par an dans un cadre de travail inspirant avec jardin avec vue sur les vignes et la lavande :) à 30 minutes de la mer et juste à côté de la célèbre Sainte Victoire propice à de superbes randonnées les week-ends !Notre entreprise incarne une mission sociale concrète en intégrant la technologie et les données pour révolutionner le recrutement et favoriser l'emploi des personnes les plus éloignées du marché du travail. Côté produit, nos innovations redéfinissent les normes de l'industrie en offrant des solutions technologiques de pointe. Côté tech, nous sommes passionnés par l'excellence technique selon les concepts de Software CraftsmanShip, le partage via notre veille et notre participation à de nombreux événements nationaux. Le tout dans un environnement de travail collaboratif, chaque membre de l'équipe progresse, contribuant ainsi à une culture d'entreprise dynamique et axée sur la croissance individuelle et collective.Quel est le processus de recrutement ?Un entretien avec Oliver (Head of data)Un échange technique avec l’équipe Data autour d’un cas concretUn entretien avec Guillaume (Head of product)Un entretien avec Nicolas (CTO)

About the job
            
 
Hi there! 🖐We are Capgemini Engineering. A brand part of the Capgemini Group.We have the mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, diversity, inclusion, a purpose of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can learn more about Capgemini Engineering here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MZ0Z6PjdnQo.You can help us to achieve our mission!Now, we are part of Capgemini Group and we have more than 300,000 team members in nearly 50 countries, and we work with sectors such as aeronautics, automotive, communications, energy, life sciences, software & internet, space & defense and consumer products.Your MissionCapgemini Engineering is constantly growing and attentive to market opportunities and in search of the best professionals to join its team. We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our team, on a hybrid format, with the possibility of participating in many interesting and cutting-edge projects through the whole life-cycle.Your Role Lead the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and efficient data-centric applications and systems, guiding and mentoring junior and mid-level engineers.Collaborate closely with stakeholders to define data strategies and roadmaps, aligning them with business objectives and ensuring their successful execution.Support the team by implementing complex functionsArchitect robust, scalable, and high-performance data solutions while ensuring compliance with industry standards and best practices.Provide expert-level guidance on data analysis, modeling, and interpretation, driving strategic decision-making processes within the organization.Oversee the implementation of advanced ETL/ELT processes while emphasizing data quality, reliability, and efficiency improvements.Drive innovation in data infrastructure and methodologies, constantly seeking ways to optimize costs and enhance performance.Act as a subject matter expert in data governance, metadata management, and ensuring adherence to data compliance regulations.Collaborate effectively across departments, offering thought leadership and presenting technical solutions to diverse stakeholders.
Your Profile 8 or more years of experience in progressively responsible data engineering roles, showcasing leadership and mentorship qualities.Extensive proficiency in data warehouse design, implementation, and optimization, demonstrating expertise in complex problem-solving and architectural decisions.Advanced proficiency in multiple programming languages used for data engineering, showcasing versatility and adaptability to varied tech stacks (Python and SQL is mandatory)Extensive hands-on experience with multiple cloud platforms and services in AWS, GCP, or Azure, demonstrating expertise in leveraging various cloud services.Extensive knowledge operating systems (Linux preferable).Deep understanding and proven expertise in data modeling, including experience in designing and implementing complex distributed systems.Extensive experience with big data technologies, having led or contributed significantly to large-scale data processing projects.Demonstrated thought leadership in data governance, metadata management, and establishing best practices for ensuring data quality and compliance.Outstanding communication skills with a proven ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.Strategic mindset with a track record of influencing decision-making processes and driving organizational data strategies.Familiarity with Standard AI/ML processes & Operations is greatly valued.Degree in computer science, software engineering, or in other engineering domains.Fluency in English is mandatory, and proficiency in additional languages is beneficial.
What we OfferOur famous atmosphere:· There’s always someone happy to start the day with a cup of coffee with you – even virtually!· We are a big company with a unique atmosphere – we make friendships, share important moments, and… simply like each other!A lot of benefits:· Referral bonuses for recommending your friends to Capgemini Engineering.· Continuous training on Next*· Offices in a great location· Participation in international projects· Integration in a multinational company· Career EvolutionLocation:· Lisbon full-time and hybridWe inform you that our recruitment process is 100% remote 🖥Capgemini Engineering is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and we do not tolerate discrimination of any kind. Whether that’s based on age, race, ethnicity, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, disability, veteran status.*Capgemini has partnered with some of the world’s leading learning and development content providers, such as Pluralsight, Harvard Management or, Harvard Spark and most recently our global partnership with Coursera to create the Next digital learning platform. ‘Next’ gives all Capgemini learners access to 250,000+ courses and 3 million learning activities from 1200 sources, empowering them to fully customize and optimize their individual learning journey. All development activities on Next are recognized internally and many externally, with numerous external certifications available free of charge.

About the job
            
 
Ihre Expertise ist gefragt ! Unser führender Kunde, ein international agierendes IT-Unternehmen, sucht zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen (Senior) Software-Architekten (m/w/d) in unbefristeter Festanstellung!  Ihre Qualifikation:  Du bist erfahren im Bereich der Software-Entwicklung & Architektur (Java, JavaScript) sowie in gängigen Frameworks (insbesondere Angular und Spring)Du zeichnest dich durch Gestaltungswillen, Experimentierfreudigkeit und Freude am Lernen ausDie Arbeit nach agilen Prinzipien macht dir SpaßDu kennst dich mit verteilten Architekturen gut aus - Docker und Kubernetes sind keine UnbekanntenDu bist entscheidungsfreudig und übernimmst gerne Verantwortung

About the job
            
 
Would you like join a team that builds a cloud native enterprise data platform?As a Platform Engineer at Lufthansa Systems Hungária, you will have the opportunity to work on an integrated airline data platform in the Azure cloud that provides a framework of PaaS services to data projects running in different areas of the airline domain.Your task will be maintaining, developing and securing cloud-based infrastructure, creating automation solutions, and gaining new knowledge through challenging technical tasks.Your responsibilities will cover Implementing cloud-based infrastructure using the Terraform frameworkBuilding tools, integrations and CI/CD pipelines to help application development teams be more efficientContribution to the evolution of the platform by enriching existing platform services and introducing new servicesSupporting operations and DevOps teams using the platform in problem resolution and solution implementationMonitoring and troubleshooting the platform componentsConducting performance analysis and system tuning
You will use the following technologies/tools Azure PaaS services: Data Factory, Databricks, Data Lake, Azure Machine Learning, Synapse, AKS, etc.Linux and Windows VM’sAzure DevOps frameworkScripting languages such as Python and bashTerraform for infrastructure deployment
You are looking for us, if You have Experience working with one of the major public cloud providers, or with operating on-premise infrastructureGeneral software development knowledge, being familiar with at least one scripting language (bash, Python, etc.)User level knowledge of Linux and Windows operating systemsExperience with the Git source control management systemBasic networking knowledge (TCP/firewalls)Problem solving and communication skills, ability to deal with vaguely defined issues and finding the root cause of various problemsWillingness to expand knowledge and keep up with the constantly improving cloud technologiesStrong team spirit and ability of self-organizing with a good sense of prioritiesCustomer-oriented mindsetEnglish knowledge both spoken and writtenWillingness to travel < 10%We are also open for applicants who studied the topics above but have not yet used them in practice
It can be an advantage if You have data engineering background
What are the benefits of joining us as an employee? Even when you work hard, you will still have time for your personal life: our flexible working hours based on core time, the exact observance of the designated number of working hours, the occasional option of working from home, and the benefits that can be extended to cover your family you can also improve your non-working life!We have long-term plans for you! We have carefully designed career paths (and a career management system), we provide the appropriate training courses and projects to accomplish your aims.Our community is characterized by mutual respect and an attitude of helpfulness. This high professional quality level and the colorful personalities will help you spend your everyday life in a good mood, why you make the best of your skills and talents.We are happy when you are open and help you discover the world: after six months you will receive substantial discounts that you can use to visit any place in the world taking Lufthansa flights!In addition to an inclusive and helpful atmosphere, trust is also an important value for us. You can rely on us with anything right from your first day, and we also trust you to the utmost extent.

About the job
            
 
At KCS IT Portugal we build business and relationships based in trust, integrity and transparency and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us.We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together. And that's not just words, if you ask for any employee at our company at least 99% will say the same!Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.Proven experience as an Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) Developer, with a minimum of 2 years in ODI development.Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and data modeling.Strong understanding of ETL concepts and best practices.Experience with Oracle databases and Oracle tools.Knowledge of data warehousing concepts.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Strong communication and teamwork skills.Ability to work independently and meet project deadlines.
We have several teams and different projects where you can join in, so apply and then we will present the best projects to fit your experience and career expectations.What we can guarantee your integration in a professional, dynamic and constantly growing team that: Values your professional and personal growth;Talent Management Program to make sure you are evolving;Unlimited training courses;Has a strong international presence and can provide you a experience abroad

About the job
            
 
Are you looking for the next professional opportunity, that will challenge you and advance your career? Join our team now!Tickmill is looking to hire a Data Engineer to join our rapidly expanding business.About Tickmill. Tickmill is an award-winning, multi-regulated broker offering a wide range of asset classes including CFDs on Forex, Stocks, Indices, Commodities, Cryptocurrencies and bonds, as well as Exchange Traded Derivatives (Futures & Options).The Tickmill Group was established in 2014 and employs over 280 individuals through its offices in London, Cyprus, Estonia, South Africa, and several other regional offices globally.Our philosophy is based on trust, transparency, and diversity, reflected in both our workplace culture and outstanding customer support. Our employees, a multilingual team of highly skilled professionals from every continent, are the backbone of the company. Their hard work and dedication are what makes it possible to rank among the best in the industry. Tickmill offers a competitive benefits package, hybrid work model, team-building events, and many opportunities for professional growth.What the job looks like?As the Data Engineer, your key responsibilities will be: Develop data integration solutions for the extraction, transformation and loading of data into Datalake and/or Data Warehouse using modern cloud-based solutions.Design and develop rich data models for data analysis purposes.Develop import procedures for gathering, storing, and analyzing corporate data from various other sources.Actively contribute to the continued design and development of organization's current data estate.Analyse business requirements and develop unique simple solutions to meet the immediate and long-term BI demands of the group
What will you need to be able to do the job? BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.At least 4 years' experience in a similar position in a financial services organization.Strong SQL skills along with strong Data Warehouse design principles knowledge.Good understanding of Datalake design practices along with basic storage formats like csv, json, parquet etc.Good understanding of object-oriented programming languages like Python and Scala.Ability to translate complex source data into a consumable format and structure.Strong business acumen, analytical skills, logical analysis, conceptual thinking, and problem-solving skills.Design and implement complex, multi-step pipelines that orchestrate data movement across different data stores.Ability in liaising with product management and content owners to produce impactful visualizations.Excellent knowledge of the English Language both written and oral is a must.Team player and having excellent communication skills is a must.
Will be considered an advantage if you have: Interest in data modelling and statistical analysis with Python or R.Familiarity with Azure cloud ecosystem.Experience in financial markets.Good knowledge in data visualization, including dashboard development and design principles using Power BI or Tableau or other reporting tools.Written and verbal communication skills and the ability to influence others.
By joining us, you can expect: A Unique Opportunity for a career in a global, fast-growing company.Attractive remuneration package based on qualifications and experience (including Discretionary Bonuses to reward exceptional performance and Loyalty Bonuses).Modern and professional work environment.Participation in our welfare investment and savings plan through our Pension Scheme (5% + 5%).A great chance to focus on your Health and Wellness through a Discount for a Gym membership, Health insurance including cover for your family, life assurance, and the ability to join the Cycle to Work Scheme.Multiple events to bond with the team and the group through Quarterly/Semestrial Team Activities for all the Company.Opportunities to learn and grow through our “Employee Training & Development program”.Hybrid working schedule.Birthday Half Day off.Loyalty benefits.
Make your next Career step and apply NOW!*Due to the great number of applications, we receive for each of our open vacancies, we are unable to respond on an individual basis.

About the job
            
 
Capgemini SW Automotive Engineering Unit based in Sophia-Antipolis is seeking a SW Integration Engineer for SDV, the next generation of innovative automotive systems, in a global and multicultural environment for a world class car tier-one. As a software integration engineer, you will be in charge of the integration of new functionalities involving several systems (ADAS, Body, Chassis). Activities also include troubleshooting, and software stabilization. You will have to : • Ensure the start-up of new platforms or OS versions. • Define and implement the integration plan for multi-system functionalities and OS.• Advise the test and validation teams in the implementation of their test plans.• Analyse the performance and robustness of the system. Technical • Automotive Industry experience (AUTOSAR stack, Diag, ECU software integration).• Solid knowledge of Android and Linux platforms.• Android, Linux, Scripting (Shell, Python), Language C++, GTest, CTS, Robot Framework • Awareness to embedded system performance (knowledge of memory access, CPU usage optimization, messaging, task scheduling, etc.)• Ability to measure, track down and analyse these problems.• Capacity to manipulate development boards that may embed different types of CPU architectures and running different real-time OS (Android and hypervised Linux). • Automated Testing: Canoe CAPL • Classic/Adaptive AUTOSAR. • Knowledge of CPU & SOC architectures. • Knowledge of Lauterbach, Trace 32, profiling, log analysis) • Automotive message bus: CAN, LIN, Ethernet – Canoe • Agile development methods (SCRUM or SaFE for teams), Jira, Gitlab, Artifactory, Confluence appreciated Soft Skills • Experience of working cross-functionally with multiples team to converge to a solution • Capacity to work autonomously in a versatile, adaptable and agile multicultural environment • Demonstrated technical, verbal, written communication skills. • Spoken French, fluent written and spoken English. The position is in Sophia Antipolis, France.Poste ouvert aux personnes en situation de handicap

About the job
            
 
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 600 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:· DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;· DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;· DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.We are looking for Data Engineers to join us in Portugal.Requirements:· At least 4 years of experience working as a Data Engineer.· Able to communicate in english (at least level B2).· Able to communicate in portuguese.· Willing to move to Portugal (you will have our help).If you’re interested please send your CV in English to liliana.moreira@decskill.com with reference "LM/DE".Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

About the job
            
 
Are you an experienced Data Engineer with a passion for Microsoft technologies?If so, join us in our journey of innovation and shape the future of data engineering! We look forward to welcoming you to our team.As a Data Engineer, you will thrive within our collaborative team, participating in high-end projects alongside skilled professionals. Your role will be pivotal as you design, develop, and implement data solutions for diverse customer environments. Leveraging your expertise in Microsoft technologies such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, Azure Storage Account (Data Lake), and SQL Server, you will create robust and efficient data pipelines using Python and SQL. Furthermore, your expertise in DevOps practices will ensure seamless data engineering processes, including CI/CD pipelines and version control.How will your day look like 💡 Collaborate with the DATA & AI team distributed among Switzerland and Barcelona, participating in high-end projects.Design, develop, and implement data solutions using Microsoft technologies (Azure Synapse, Databricks, Azure Storage Account, SQL Server).Create and optimize data pipelines using Python and SQL.Implement DevOps practices for data engineering, including CI/CD pipelines and version control.Utilize concepts such as snowflake and star schema in data modeling.Visualize data effectively using Power BI.
Your profile 👩‍💻 3-5 years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong focus on Microsoft technologies.Proficiency in Azure Synapse, Databricks, Azure Storage Account (Data Lake), and SQL Server.Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.Experience with DevOps practices for data engineering.Familiarity with data modeling concepts such as snowflake and star schema.Ability to create insightful visualizations using Power BI.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.'Can do' mindset and proactive attitude.Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.Excellent communication skills in English, enabling effective collaboration with colleagues and clients.Fluency in German and/or French would be a great plus.EU citizen or possessing a valid Spanish work visa.
If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can add value to our crew, we’d love to learn more about you.What we offer 🚀 Permanent contract, choosing between full-time and part-time.Competitive salary package, plus interesting fringe benefits.Flexible working hours for an optimal work-life balance.Being based in Barcelona or nearby, you have the flexibility to work from home according to your needs.Compensation for monthly home office expenses and work set up extension.Structured career development plan based on your professional goals.Yearly training budget, Microsoft Certifications and bi-weekly “Tech Lunches“.Choose your own hardware.Free language classes.One additional week of vacation for Corporate Social Responsibility.Annual team event in Switzerland.A dynamic environment and a unique team spirit!
How to find out if this is the next step of your career: Apply 📩Discovery call with HR 🧐Interview - video call with Team Lead and HR 🤝Final assessment 👩‍💻
🧡 Our commitment: to give you feedback on each step, both in positive and negative cases🕔 Estimated time: 4 weeks

About the job
            
 
Company DescriptionWith 25 years under our belt, Devoteam we’re a strong global player with over 10,000 professionals across 20 countries. Our values are rooted in diversity, inclusion, and continuous learning. In Sweden, where we have been present since 2000, our offices in Stockholm, Malmö, and Halmstad reflect our dedication to accessibility and a balanced workspace.As a Premier and MSP Partner of Google, we’re quite hands-on. We focus on Infrastructure Modernization, Data Management, Smart Analytics, Application Modernization, and AI & Machine Learning. It’s about practical innovation, and together with Google, we’re good at it. We work on meaningful projects and support over 2,500 customers in 20 countries. It’s about making things happen and shaping the future tangibly. Join us, and let’s build what’s next, together.  Job DescriptionAs a Senior Data Engineer at Devoteam G Cloud Sweden you will work as a part of the specialised team helping our customers to innovate and improve their business through the usage of the Google Cloud Platform.Your main responsibility will be to design, develop and deliver custom-made data solutions (databases, data pipelines and data warehousing) addressing the specific needs of our customers. Always striving for efficiency and high quality you will use your knowledge and experience to find the best answers.You will become the trusted and valued subject-matter expert and advisor for both our clients and other members of our team, supporting the pre-sale activities and helping others to get up to speed and resolve the issues that they face. You can expect to be engaged in different projects that will both utilise and greatly expand your knowledge of and understanding of different companies and industries.  QualificationsAbout you:You are a person with true passion for working with Data in the Cloud,  who enjoys the challenge and figuring out the best solutions. You are keeping up with the constantly evolving technology thanks to your curiosity and willingness to keep on learning.As a Senior team member you are capable of independent work, prioritising your tasks and driving your own projects. At the same time you enjoy interacting with other  passionate professionals, sharing insights and ideas to find the best possible solutions.Working in a client-facing role you are a great communicator, able to both understand the customers’ needs and translate them into technical requirements, as well as hold presentations and workshops adapted to your audience.You also have a strong business mindset. You are able to identify business needs, set business goals and outcomes. You also know how to track these and make sure they are reached. You understand business concepts and can spot potential opportunities.To succeed in this role we believe you have: Comprehensive experience designing, developing and deploying databases, data pipelines and data warehousesAn understanding of data warehousing concepts, setups and data warehouse design patternsSolid programming skills in Python or JavaPrevious experience of working with Data in the Cloud, preferably GCPGood communication skills and ability to cooperate with diverse teams and customersFull proficiency in English
  Additional InformationWe offer you: Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.An international, diverse, and inclusive team.A human-centric and value-based company culture.Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).A modern office in central Stockholm.Full provision of work tools.A variety of social events.
About Devoteam G Cloud Sweden:At Devoteam, you’ll find a forward-thinking workspace. We’re big on fostering a culture of continuous learning and career progression. Our team is genuine, inclusive, and ready to welcome you.We keep work hours flexible to ensure you strike that work-life balance just right.Our benefits are built from genuine concern and an eye for balance. Think wellness grants for healthier living, parental leave compensation for invaluable family time, insurance for peace of mind, and some well-thought-out social events to bond with your colleagues. Plus, continuous learning is close to our hearts, so expect a certifications program that has your back.In a nutshell, at Devoteam, we care.

About the job
            
 
At Matrix42 we empower our product squads to solve hard problems – customer problems and business problems – in ways that our customers love yet work for our business. Our product squads are cross-functional and durable, generally composed of a product manager, a product designer, and several engineers.As a Big Data & Analytics Engineer in an empowered product team, your role extends beyond the purely technical realm. Alongside your specialized data engineering responsibilities, you play a key part in the product manager/Big Data & Analytics Engineer/product designer trifecta, where you collaborate on product decisions.Collaborating on product as a Big Data & Analytics Engineer means you need to team up with your product manager, engineers and designers to identify and address the needs of your customers. This role involves leveraging your skills in data analysis and interpretation to drive decision-making and guide the development of effective, data-driven solutions.YOUR MISSION Being an excellent collaborator and building a trusted relationship with your squad. Providing technical insight into analytics and data capabilities within a SaaS platform development team and executing the development aspect of our analytic capabilities.Promoting a strong product mindset.Assessing feasibility. Tackle risks early, collaborate with product managers, engineering managers and members of the squad or senior leadership to iterate on framing the problem and iteratively, incrementally find technical solutions that is applicable in the context.Working to open up possibilities. Work with architects and engineers to design and evolve our data strategy, and the necessary infrastructure for our analytics and data platform, always thinking at scale.Being an enabler of ideas and people. Act as subject matter expert into enabling technologies, providing guidance, training and support to other squad members and stakeholders.
MUST HAVES 5+ years of professional experience in software development, ideally in a data and/or analytics related field.Bachelor’s Degree in an applicable field, such as computer science or computer engineering, or a related field with a focus on Data Science – for example, Mathematics or Statistics.Specific knowledge in analytics related languages such as Python or Scala, and technologies like Hadoop or Spark, Hive or Pig.Very good understanding of SQL and relational databases, as well as NoSQL and unstructured databases – including experience in scaling data models and databases to hundreds of Terabytes of data.A good understanding of data transformation and ETL pipelines.A deep understanding of technology, and more specifically analytical engines such as Azure Synapse, Google BigQuery or Snowflake.
NICE TO HAVE Experience in PowerBI or Tableau would be an important bonus skill.Data visualization tools such as Matplotlib, Seaborn or ggplot2.Experience with Microsoft Azure as the technology platform for data analytics.An excellent understanding of Machine Learning and use of frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, etc.
FOR YOUWe could tell you all about the flexible working hours, 25 days of vacation or that remote work is part of everyday life. But in our eyes, that's not a benefit, it's standard. Here are some of our benefit offers: Learning & Development OpportunitiesUp to 6 additional days off for personal or professional developmentLog into our online platforms to expand your knowledge or improve your language skills.One Social Day is for you to assist in social settings or attend events which help improve our environment.The possibility to choose the benefits that works for you either a fitness membership, a retirement plan, meal tickets, etc.
And many more... ask us about it! JOIN USSend us your application, including your salary requirements and earliest possible starting date. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Antonela Negulescu.We ask for your understanding that MATRIX42 can only accept applications online via the applicant portal in connection with our applicant management system due to the currently valid EU data protection regulations.

About the job
            
 
De job Vanuit je rol als Cloud Engineer ondersteun je onze klanten met de migratie van hun klassiek softwareontwikkelingsmodel naar een PaaS-oplossing. Je zorgt mee voor technische innovatie en efficiëntie door repetetieve zaken te automatiseren.  Naast ontwerp en design van de cloud omgeving, ondersteun je continuous integration en de delivery pipeline (CI/CD). Verder is het verbeteren en het verzekeren van de security (zowel technisch als procesmatig) van de cloud infrastructuur ook een cruciaal onderdeel van jouw takenpakket.  Om dit te realiseren, werk je nauw samen met het development team.  Wie we zoeken   Jij bent gebeten door systeem- en netwerkbeheer, efficiëntie en automatisatie. Je bent een cloud liefhebber met kennis van een aantal cloud providers, wij werken hoofdzakelkijk met Oracle CloudEen brede kennis van automatisatietools: Linux, Gitlab, Jenkins en Ansible, …Communicatie is cruciaal, je begrijpt de noden van de verschillende technische teams en kan ze ook met de neuzen in dezelfde richting brengen. Proactiviteit is sterk bij jou aanwezig: je werkt actief mee aan de zoektocht naar de beste oplossing.Je bent leergierig en volgt de nieuwste technologische trends en ontwikkelingen.
  Ons aanbodBij Droppar kom je terecht in een innovatieve en uitdagende werkomgeving waar onze collega’s en klanten centraal staan. Openheid, transparantie en vertrouwen staan bovenaan ons lijstje van bedrijfswaarden. Ruimte voor initiatief en ondernemerschap zitten in ons DNA. Je komt terecht in een team van experts met wie je kennis kan delen en waar je elkaar kan inspireren. Tijdens onze kennisdelingssessies kom je ook regelmatig met de verschillende teams in contact.Naast een stel gepassioneerde en toffe collega’s hebben wij jou natuurlijk nog veel meer te bieden:  Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met een bedrijfswagen en tankkaart;Een uitgebreid pakket aan voordelen en kortingen;Tal van social events (shortski, familiedag/weekend, afterwork drinks,…);Een gepersonaliseerd groeiplan;Verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden en trainingen om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen.

About the job
            
 
En rejoignant IT Link, vous intégrez une équipe projet qui évolue dans un environnement industriel automobile dynamique. Vous intégrerez l’équipe du département électronique en tant qu’ingénieur Systèmes pour des projets de notre client basé à Blois.Après une phase d’intégration, vous serez en charge de la définition des exigences systèmes sous Polarion, de la définition des solutions sous Simulink et de leurs validations sur le moyen de test adéquat (Banc statique, HIL, banc moteur ou véhicule).Vous travaillerez en autonomie mais échangerez quotidiennement avec des interlocuteurs internes variés dans un contexte multiculturel (interaction avec des collègues anglais, chinois ou indiens). Vous pourrez également être en contact avec des interlocuteurs du client.Profil RecherchéVous êtes diplômé(e) d'études supérieures en Mécatronique/Électronique et vous avez une expérience significative réussie sur un poste similaire dans le secteur automobile.Votre anglais est courant (indispensable)Connaissances solides en Matlab SIMULINK, dans l’utilisation de moyens d’essai, en contrôle moteur et électronique analogique.Alors n’hésitez plus, devenez Linker afin de nous accompagner dans la réalisation des rêves de demain !Salaire : à partir de 38k (négociable selon votre profil et vos expériences)Rejoindre IT Link c’est intégrer une entreprise soucieuse de donner du sens à ses actions, en mettant l’accent sur la proximité avec nos collaborateurs dans des contextes projets innovants.Retrouvez plus de détails sur nos engagements : https://www.itlink.fr/le-groupe.A ProposEngagé.e.s pour l'égalité des chances, nous pensons que la diversité est une richesse. Nous savons respecter, apprécier et valoriser les différences de chacun.e : ce sont vos qualités humaines qui seront considérées.“Connect and Create for Change”... with us !IT Link, expert des systèmes connectésChez IT Link, cela fait 35 ans que nous misons sur la connexion des technologies, des objets et des personnes pour apporter des réponses aux grands défis actuels de notre société (environnement, santé, sécurité…).Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leurs projets d’innovation et de transformation, des technologies embarquées à l’application métier en passant par le cloud et la science des données.Pour cela, nous comptons sur nos 750 Linkers présent.e.s sur 14 agences réparties dans le monde (France, Benelux, Canada et Maroc). A horizon 2025, l’objectif est d’atteindre 1000 collaborateurs.trices pour soutenir notre forte croissance.

About the job
            
 
¡Hola!En NTT Data Alicante buscamos un perfil Data Engineer con conocimientos en Spark/Scala para sumarse a nuestro equipo:Requisitos: Perfil referente en tareas de análisis y desarrollo en Spark/Scala de manera autónoma.Conocimiento en AWS.Experiencia desarrollando consultas SQL complejas y con datasets complejos.Funciones de transformación y concepto lazy.DataFrames y gestión de SparkSession.Conceptos cluster y servidor de Spark, particiones y su comportamiento a nivel físico.Optimización de querys, brodcast join, tamaño de particiones del dataframe.Conocimientos del ecosistema compatible con Spark: Kassandra, Hadoop, Hive, Kafka y bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales.
Deseable: Conocimiento funcional.Conocimiento avanzado de AWS.Java Apache Flink.Experiencia en gestión y ejecución de proyectos ágiles: Scrum.
Competencias: Define, construye, desarrolla, implementa y testea la solución aplicando un profundo conocimiento.Incorpora y difunde best practices, liderando así la mejora continua y eficiencia en su ámbito de especialización.Pensamiento crítico, ofrece los argumentos apropiados y utiliza su conocimiento y experiencia, teniendo en cuenta las necesidades del cliente, consiguiendo generar un impacto en las decisiones tomadas.Trabaja, promueve y supervisa que se trabaja conforme a la metodología y estándares de calidad, aún cuando las condiciones iniciales son difíciles. Es un referente e impulsa su uso.Planifica, gestiona y garantiza el cumplimiento de los hitos marcados. Gestiona de manera efectiva los contratiempos que puedan surgir en el desarrollo del proyecto.Atiende de manera proactiva las reclamaciones del cliente.
¿Qué ofrecemos?: Contrato indefinido.Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportada.Plan de Carrera: desarrollo profesional y proyección internacional a tu medida.Plan de Formación personalizado a nivel profesional y técnico.Beneficios sociales: Ayuda Flex, Seguro Médico, Seguro de Vida y de Accidentes.
Si consideras reúnes los requisitos para el puesto y te gustan los desafíos, no lo dudes….¡Envíanos tu CV!NTT DATA somos todos y todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad: Telecomunicaciones, Entidades Financieras, Industria, Utilities, Energía, Administración Pública y Sanidad.¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.¿Tú también eres un #DigitalLover?

About the job
            
 
Who We AreFounded in 2017, Unit8 is a fast-growing Swiss AI and data analytics consulting and services company dedicated to solving complex problems of traditional industries like automotive, chemical, financial services, manufacturing and pharma. We work with some of the biggest organisations in Europe to solve the challenges that directly affect their business - be it operations, finance, manufacturing or R&D. Since our foundation, we have successfully delivered more than 135 projects and have grown to 100+ talented individuals across 5 office locations.Unit8's mission is to drive the adoption of AI and Data Science in the non-digital industries and to help accelerate their digital transformation. Among its activities, Unit8 dedicates a part of its resources and time on projects that deeply matter to us - that includes collaboration on pro-bono and "engineering for good" causes. You can learn more about what we are passionate about at Unit8 Talks and on our website you can find more useful information about our business and recruiting process.These are some examples of projects that we have been working on Building a real-time production line monitoring system for the pharmaceutical industry in order to improve the throughput of the production processes for the Pharmaceutical Industry. Technologies: AWS, EKS, CloudFormation, Docker, PythonBuilding system for calculating and delivering global climate scores i.e. estimating the impact of climate change on the risk of natural disasters (i.e. floods, wildfires & droughts) for the Insurance Industry. Technologies: PySpark, Python, Proprietary Data Processing PlatformBuilding a modern data science platform including a data lake for Chemical Industry. Technologies: Azure, ML Studio, Data Factory, Databricks, Spark
About YouAs a member of agile project teams, your mission will be to build solutions and infrastructure aiming at solving the business problems of our clients. You are a proficient software engineer who knows the fundamentals of computer science and you master at least one widely adopted programming language (Python, Java, C#, C++).You know how to write distributed services and work with high-volume heterogeneous data, preferably with distributed systems such as Spark.You are knowledgeable about data governance, data access, and data storage techniques.You have strong client-facing skills: comfortable interacting with clients (business & technical audience), delivering presentations, problem-solving mindset.You are willing to travel to meet with our clients and the team (mainly in Europe - up to 10% of your time).You are eligible to register as a sole trader (self-employment) in Poland. Don't worry if you don't know how to do the registration, we can help with that.
What You'll Do Design, build, maintain, and troubleshoot data pipelines and processing systems that are relied on for both production and analytics applications, using a variety of open-source and closed-source technologies.Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve data quality.Collaborate with other software engineers, ML experts, and stakeholders, taking learning and leadership opportunities that will arise every single day.Work in multi-functional agile teams to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new product objectives.
What we offer Opportunity to shape the expansion of one of the leading Swiss data & AI consultanciesCompensation package including base salary, yearly bonus based on the both individual + company performanceAbove the norm flexibility regarding when and from where you work as long as both client and internal commitments are metWork on cutting-edge data, AI & analytics topics (e.g., Generative AI) that have real impact across industriesDedicated time and budget for training and pro-bono projects30 paid days offPrivate health care and MultisportCross offices/company-wide frequent events (off-site or online) as well as quarterly budget to spend with the team on after-work activities

About the job
            
 
About UsWe are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.About The RoleIn the Digital System Operation team, we support national and international grid operators in the integration of renewable energies into the power grid, the upgrading of existing control systems and the secure management of power grids with a high share of renewable energies.To strengthen our team, we are looking for a Data Model Engineer for the configuration of highly critical control systems.Tasks Creation and maintenance of data models in the control system that represent the physical power gridChecking the data integration of the devices in the fieldChecking the data quality and consistency between the data sources and the control systemActive participation in the data modelling improvement and automated testing tools for quality assuranceCollaboration in projects in the control system environment and support in the further development of the teamActive exchange and coordination with customers in connection with the planning and project planning of network models
For this position, we will consider both Senior and the candidates at mid-level of experience. Apply for this exciting position and start working for DNV in Germany.What we offerExciting work environment: working at an important key point in the energy transition, working on the systems to ensure a secure power supply in Germany, possibility of developing as a Project ManagerWorking environment: own company notebook, close collaboration in an agile team, connection to public transportWork-life balance: 39-hour working week (full-time), possibility to work part-time, flexible working hours through flextime, 30 days holiday per year, free drinks and fruitFinancial benefits: share in company profits, company-financed accident and pension insurance in addition to gross salary, (e-)bike leasing via JobRad, public transport ticket allowance, discounts in the company restaurantAbout You You have an academic degree or technician qualification in computer science, electrical engineering or a comparable qualificationYou work independently, have high-quality standards for your results and attach great importance to meeting deadlinesIdeally, you have experience in one or more programming languages, e.g. Python, C#Basic knowledge of IT systems, in particular (electricity) control systems and the German electricity grid is an advantageAdvanced German language skills (at least C1 level)Knowledge of English is an advantage

About the job
            
 
With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organisations, and beyond. The Data Engineer Team Leader will be responsible for designing, optimizing and maintaining the department's current and future data related solutions and act as a champion for data integrity, consistency and reusability within all areas of analytics, by adopting a product-oriented approach to the creation of analytics deliverables. More specifically the role includes the following responsibilities:  Lead and manage a group of data engineers on new and existing data related initiatives and ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects;Design, implement, maintain, monitor and optimize current and future data/reporting/analytics platforms/solutions in order to address data related needs;Work closely with Data Analyst team in order to successfully deliver end-to-end data projects;Understand and promote data framework best practices and key technologies so as to effectively support existing and future business requirements;Integrate, transform, and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems in order to make them available for reporting/analytics solutions;Set up and maintain automated processes according to the business requirements i.e. invoicing process; andIdentify areas to increase efficiency and automation of processes.
Requirements BSc degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related subject;5+ years of experience in ETL/ELT, Data Modeling, Data Warehouse Architecture and Reporting tools;Knowledge of Data Governance;Strong knowledge of writing queries, stored procedures, views, functions and triggers for Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL);Strong knowledge of SQL Server Database Tuning and Query Optimization techniques;Experience with analysis, design, and development of large high-performance databases;Exceptional attention to quality, detail, and be comfortable working as part of an extended team on an agile delivery plan;Resourceful, creative, self-motivated and eager to learn; andEnglish fluency and strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Other desirable attributes include: Experience with Azure Data platforms such as Synapse Analytics, Data Lake, Databricks;Experience as Team Leader/Manager;Experience in working with multidimensional databases (e.g. MS Analysis Services); Work experience in credit or debt portfolio data management, analytics or reporting;Knowledge of Python and/or other OOP languages;Knowledge of R statistical language; andFamiliarity with statistical tools and predictive modelling concepts.
BenefitsOn top of a challenging work environment, we are offering:💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile, and data plan🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, and indoor parking👨‍⚕ Private health insurnce, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor🏝️ Flexible working model🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room💡 Career and talent development tools🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG, and volunteering activitiesYour race, gender identity and expression, age ethnicity or disability make no difference in Qualco. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based only on their ability and behavior.Disclaimer: Qualco collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. About the job
            
 
✔ Are you a skilled analytics professional with a passion for data modeling, ETL processes, and enabling self-service platforms?✔ Do you have experience with dbt and Snowflake, and a strong desire to help organizations make data-driven decisions?✔ Are you skilled at creating compelling visualizations that effectively communicate insights and tell a story?Then Xomnia is the place for you!As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will transform raw data into valuable insights that drive business decisions. Your daily tasks will include working with clients to understand their reporting and analytics needs, building data models to support those needs, and collaborating with other engineering teams to integrate data warehouse best practices with other systems and applications. You will work on diverse projects, such as transforming Excel spreadsheets into a cloud-based data pipeline and building data models for advanced analytics. You will also develop strategies for self-service analytics and implement state-of-the-art tools to create robust data platforms that empower our clients' business stakeholders.Please note that for this position, we are looking for candidates who have the legal right to work in the Netherlands as we do not sponsor applicants to live in the Netherlands.What you will need: At least 3 years of experience building and maintaining ETL processes using dbt or similar tools for accurate and efficient data modelingProficiency in SQL and experience with ETL tools such as dbt or TalendProficiency in Power BI/Tableau and experience creating impactful visualizations and dashboardsAt least 3 years of experience creating and maintaining data models, with a focus on scalability, performance, and securityA strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and best practicesExperience with cloud-based data warehousing solutions such as Snowflake, Redshift, Azure, and BigQueryFluent in Dutch and English
Additionally, we are looking for someone who has: Experience working with clients to understand their reporting and analytics needs, developing data models to support those needs, and managing stakeholder relationships and expectations.Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with clients and other engineering teamsThe ability to work independently and as part of a teamStrong problem-solving skills to identify and resolve data issues, as well as provide technical support to clients' data users.
What we offer: Competitive salary25 vacation days and the possibility of taking unpaid leaveRoom to grow and develop yourselfPaid time for self developmentChallenging assignmentsCompany laptop of your choiceWork from home packageA monthly in-depth training facilitated by colleagues or external trainersNice colleagues who besides work also like to undertake activitiesCompany trips and activities like the Xomnia WKD, ski trip, and weekly sports activities
About us:We are Xomnia, the AI consulting company. We’re curious problem solvers who believe data will change the way we live, work and communicate. Being at the forefront of this revolutionary change in a sustainable, positive way is what drives us.We solve challenging data science and engineering projects, from start to finish. From developing an application for real-time fraud detection on Google Cloud Platform, to setting up a customized recommender engine in an existing Microsoft Azure environment - we develop and deploy tailor-made data science solutions.Xomnia started in 2013 in one room in the heart of Amsterdam. These days we take up nearly two houses. But more than just a workspace, we're a community that values authenticity. Here, everyone is encouraged to be themselves, to learn, and to have fun in the process.Representing over 20 nationalities, our team values the unique cultural perspective that each individual brings to the table. Moreover, with the Dutch tech sector seeing a female representation around 11%, we are proud that over 30% of our workforce is female. Nevertheless, we recognize that there is more to be done, and we continue working to overcome barriers that still exist.We encourage all candidates to apply, and we don’t discriminate based on race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age. However, a reality that we face is that many of our clients prefer to communicate in Dutch, making Dutch proficiency essential for some roles. Additionally, while we wish that we could sponsor visas for everyone, there are instances when it is not feasible.If you're experienced, passionate, and align with our values, we want to hear from you.
